title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 If you're a Senior Backend Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us! You will have the chance to:
   

  

* Work with a talented and diverse team in a culture that values innovation and collaboration.
* Take on meaningful challenges and grow with the latest technologies.
* Enjoy flexibility with hybrid work options and a healthy work-life balance.
* Benefit from competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, including healthcare insurance, pension contributions, and wellness allowance.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Frontend Developer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 You’re a Frontend Developer who thrives in a fast-paced, data-driven, analytical and agile environment. Your soft skills shine and you can communicate with ease in English. You are passionate about technology, team work, but also have a responsibility and autonomy in your work. You are able to work efficiently in a remote work environment, in a setting where online and asynchronous communication is the foundation. You will be joining the Product team and working on the integration of the app with external temperature measuring devices.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 



* Ship top-quality, performant, accessible, inclusive user interfaces, features and products
* Work on the device integrations with the Natural Cycles core App (built as a Hybrid Web application, packaged for iOS and Android)
* Work in an agile team together with other software engineers, product manager, designers & testers
* Work in close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization to deliver top-quality user interfaces and features
* Work hands-on with data insights and analytics and if possible, always take the data driven approach
* Ensure continuous delivery of new releases while working in an agile way
* Maintain a healthy codebase



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* Experience in frontend development: building websites, web applications, responsive layout
* Good understanding of modern CSS (e.g Flexbox, Grid), experience with modern pre/post-processors, such as SASS, PostCSS
* Experience with TypeScript and Angular framework (or ability to quickly learn)
* Experience working with git, github, pull requests, code review etc.



  





**Not required but it would be a bonus if you also have:** 



* Experience with native iOS (Swift) and/or Android (Kotlin) development, or app development in general
* Experience with building software that integrates with connected devices (via Bluetooth, API etc)
* Experience with Node.js backend development
* A passion for women’s health



  





**Our technology stack includes:** 



* TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js running on GCP AppEngine
* Ionic, Angular, Capacitor, React
* Firebase Hosting
* Highly automated CI pipelines (Github Actions)
* AppStore/GooglePlay releases on a biweekly basis
* We <3 Open Source, encourage Open Source contributions and often open our general-purpose repositories



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the product team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



 Not living in Sweden? No problem! We offer relocation support to help you move.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



  





 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.
 



  





**Note: We are not looking for consultants or help from recruitment agencies**

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Frontend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about frontend technologies
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Are you fluent in Swedish? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Frontend Developer** 




 Your role as a Frontend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



  





 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



  





 In addition, you will:
 


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy frontend solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of front-end development. You’re passionate about building scalable, and maintainable user interfaces and enjoy collaborating with teams across functions to deliver exceptional digital experiences.
 



 As a person, you are flexible and adaptable and can see yourself thriving in working in a fast-paced start-up like environment.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, frontend development
* At least 5 years of experience in frontend development, especially within modern frontend stacks
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG, etc.) to build inclusive and compliant web applications
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Due to a client requirement, fluency in Swedish is a strict requirement for this position



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* Proficiency in React, Vue, Next.js or other React frameworks
* Javascript, HTML, CSS
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence



  





 Read more about Valtech and what you can expect from us by clicking on "Apply".

title: Fullstack Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Fullstack Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment?
 



  





 Are you based in Sweden with ability to work on-site with our clients in the Stockholm area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Fullstack Developer** 




 As a Fullstack Developer, you will play a pivotal role as both a consultant/client advisor, and a hands-on developer. Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



  





 Your role as a consultant/client advisor will not only entail providing technical knowledge but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



  





 Assignments and clients vary, but our main aim is to always make great high-quality customer experiences that last. We achieve this by using technical solutions that add value, not just for our clients, but also for their customers.
 



  





 In addition, you will:
 


* Act as a trusted advisor to our clients, offering guidance and solutions to address their business needs
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy fullstack solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a skilled full-stack developer with around 5 years of experience working across both front-end and back-end technologies. You're comfortable navigating diverse tech stacks, and you take pride in writing clean, maintainable code.
 



  





 You enjoy collaborating with various stakeholders, both internal and external, and fellow developers, translating business requirements into technical solutions that add value. With a passion for learning and staying current with industry trends, you’re eager to contribute to dynamic projects while continuously growing your skill set.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* Around 5 years of experience in fullstack development, with hands-on experience in modern frameworks and technologies
* A proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* A willingness to move freely within the entire technology stack and experience working in agile working environment
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Fluency in Swedish and English



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* .NET Core /C#, Node.js
* React, TypeScript, Vue
* Headless CMS architectures and technologies
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence



  





**Bonus if you also have:** 



* Experience or strong interest in Angular and Ruby on Rails
* CMS/eCommerce platforms like Sitecore, Adobe, Optimizely, etc.
* A cloud provider like Azure or AWS



  





 Read more about life at Valtech and what we offer by clicking on "Apply".

title: Project Developer
description:
Are you ready to take your career to new heights in the renewable energy sector? A leading company in Stockholm, Sweden, is seeking a talented Project Developer specialising in Solar PV & Wind. This role offers the chance to be at the forefront of sustainable energy projects, contributing to a greener future while advancing your professional journey.
 



  





 This position provides the unique advantage of collaborating with industry experts, utilising cutting-edge technology, and playing a pivotal role in the development of renewable energy solutions. The successful candidate will enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for professional growth and development.
 



  





 The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in project development within the renewable energy sector, specifically Solar PV and Wind. A strong understanding of the technical, financial, and regulatory aspects of renewable energy projects is essential. The role demands excellent project management skills, including the ability to oversee projects from inception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time and within budget.
 



  





 Key responsibilities include identifying and evaluating new project sites, conducting feasibility studies, securing necessary permits and approvals, and managing stakeholder relationships. Exceptional communication and negotiation skills are crucial, as the role involves liaising with government authorities, landowners, and other key stakeholders.
 



  





 A degree in engineering, environmental science, or a related field is highly desirable, along with a minimum of three years of relevant experience. Proficiency in Swedish and English is required, as is the ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
 



  





 This is more than just a job; it's a chance to make a tangible impact on the environment and society. If you are passionate about renewable energy and possess the skills and experience required, this role could be the perfect next step in your career. Embrace the challenge and be part of a mission to create a sustainable future.

title: Software Engineer - Open banking
description:
**Company Description**
 Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.
   

  

 Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.
   

  

**Job Description**
 At Tink, we deliver open banking solutions as a part of Visa. We’re creating the foundations that a new world of finance will be built on. By constantly challenging ourselves to go further and do better, we’re developing the ground-breaking services that businesses will use, to revolutionize the way millions of people manage their money. The world of financial services is changing fast, and we will continue to be at the forefront of it.
   

  

 Tink is building an open banking platform that enables banks, fintechs and startups to develop data-driven financial services. Through one API, Tink allows customers to access aggregated financial data, initiate payments, enrich transactions and build personal finance management tools. Tink connects to more than 3,400 banks that reach over 250 million bank customers across Europe. Our solutions are ready-to-go products, each developed to solve specific problems and bring value to both businesses and their customers.
   

  

**What we offer you:**
 You will be working in an international environment where your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Work with Tink’s technologies which is mainly Java, AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Datadog, REST and much more.
* Develop reliable, scalable, high performance and highly distributed systems that power open banking products for different markets using your technical expertise.
* Innovate around new features and measure how these features perform, being instrumental in bringing the product vision to life.
* Collaborate and build high-quality products by following best engineering practices.


 We strongly believe in the power of collaboration, both within our team and in partnership with other teams and stakeholders. Working together is the cornerstone of building exceptional teams, delivering outstanding products, and fostering personal growth. It forms the very essence of our work culture and defines how we operate.
   

  

 This is a hybrid position, and we would like you to be in office three days per week.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 We are currently seeking a talented individual to join the Engineering organization, working from our office in central Stockholm. We see that you enjoy working with others and that you have a passion for what you do. You want to better the product you are working on as well as your knowledge and skills.
   

  

 We would like you to have:
   

  

* Proven experience working as backend engineer with Java technologies
* Experience with a fast-paced environment that is product centric
* Experience from working with DevOps methodologies and tools
* Experience working with agile methodologies and understand the value of tracking engineering key metrics


**Additional Information**
 Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: C++ Developer
company_industry: Security and Investigations and Software Development
description:
We believe that you are dreaming of using your skills in C++ and your innovative mindset to create a better democratic world. Especially by solving crimes, gathering intelligence, investigating fraud and fighting corruption. At MSAB we make that dream come true!
   

  

 MSAB is one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies. We develop digital forensic solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used globally. Working with programming you will perform demanding tasks that tickles your innovative mindset and challenge your technical skills to find your way forward towards a solution.
   

  

 If you are inspired by extracting and decrypting data, writing decoders and implementations, decoding apps, analyzing data structure and making them readable. Then you are interesting to us.
   

  

 If you also are capable in writing efficient code, embedded programming, have knowledge in Android and iOS operating systems and have skills in reverse engineering or perhaps cryptology. Then we want to know more about you.
   

  

 This is a chance to work in a company culture described as friendly, we listen to new ideas and help each other. You will have freedom to find your way forward and benefit from your innovative thinking. If this is a match and you also are inspired by being pushed beyond your comfort zone. Then we want to talk with you.
   

  

 There is so much to talk about like values, plans forward, benefits, ways of working and technology for example. But we save that for the interview.
   

  

 Send your application now!
   

  

 For more information about the role, you are welcome to contact torgny.sodrin@msab.com.
   

  

 For more information about MSAB: https://www.msab.com/
   

  

 MSAB is a world leader in forensic technology for extracting and analyzing data from mobile devices. The MSAB vision is to empower every investigation with digital forensic solutions for a safer world.
   

  

 MSAB deliver high quality digital forensic solutions to extract, review, analyze and manage data and are a trusted partner to Law Enforcement, Defense Forces, Government Agencies and Forensic Laboratories in democratic countries throughout the world enabling them to investigate crime, gather intelligence, investigate fraud and fight corruption. Our values encompass being an ethics-driven company focused on innovation and results.

title: Software Engineer
description:
*Are you a passionate and experienced Software Engineer looking for a highly technical organisation working at the core of the Internet? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can design, build, and maintain rock-solid services? If so, we want to hear from you!* 




  





 As a Software Engineer you should have proven experience in the technology industry with a passion for what you do. You are curious about new technologies and experienced in designing and developing robust and secure solutions. You enjoy solving problems whatever they may be.
 



  





  
 



**Key responsibilities** 




 As a Software Engineer at Netnod, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality software and systems used both internally and externally. You will collaborate with a small team of skilled engineers, including both employees and consultants, to develop innovative solutions and ensure system reliability.
 



 In this role, you will among other things do the following:
 



  




* Lead and participate in the planning, design, coding, testing and deployment of new software in all our environments (locally, staging, production)
* Help evolve and document our internal best practices and coach more junior colleagues
* Troubleshoot and resolve issues in production systems
* Identify repetitive tasks and help automate them
* Take responsibility for the entire lifecycle of tasks, which includes designing, planning, implementing and delivering results
* Collaborate with team members and other departments to develop high-quality software solutions



    
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Several years of proven experience as a developer with an interest in different languages. We’re mainly using Golang on the backend and typescript on the frontend
* You’re working in a modern developer setup and able to navigate a Unix system
* Familiarity with agile development methodologies and CI/CD practices
* You have experience from modern, microservice based architectures using tools such as GitLab/GitHub, Kubernetes and Prometheus
* You have a good understanding of the challenges in building highly scalable and solid solutions
* Good interpersonal skills and a sense of drive
* Good language skills in both English and Swedish



  





*Note: This role is covered by the Swedish Legislation on Protective Security act and is subject to security screening and background checks.* 




  
 



  





**Location** 




 This role is located at our office in Solna, Stockholm. The role reports directly to the Head of Development.
 



  





**Employee benefits** 




 We offer an informal but highly professional culture with an emphasis on work-life balance for all our employees. Our attractive remuneration package provides a full range of benefits including: 
 



  




* private health insurance
* health and wellbeing memberships
* six weeks vacation
* generous pension
* other insurances
* 10% of your time allocated for professional development



  





**Application** 




 Are you interested in becoming a part of our team? 
 



 To apply, please send us your application. Applications will be reviewed as they arrive and interviews with qualified candidates will start as soon as they have been reviewed.
 



  





 If you have any questions regarding the role, you are welcome to contact Head of Development, Jonas Johansson, by email: jonas@netnod.se or at +46 76-812 27 78‬.
 



  





 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 You will act as both Tech Lead and Manager, in a perfect mix of leading people (Team of Developers) and developing code. Our aim is to consolidate the team of developers that you will lead in Stockholm. You will collaborate with your Product Partner, regarding planning and building the right products at the right time. You will be responsible for defining clear goals for your team and lead them in delivering on those goals.
   

  

 Apart from this, you are also responsible for setting salaries, helping individuals on your team grow and developing, as well as contributing technically to the team.
   

  

 As Tech Lead Manager you have a holistic perspective and the ability to inspire and lead others. You love working with tech and have experience working as a developer, working with code reviews, testing and quality assurance. You have at least one area where your team can rely on you making strong technical contributions.
   

  

* Communicate and collaborate with stakeholders
* Define quarterly goals and do weekly follow-ups
* Support and make sure the team members are the best they can be
* Develop and coach your team members individually
* Facilitate daily stand-ups and advise on agile WoW
* Contribute technically (wherever your strong area is) to the team


**Requirements**
* MSc/BS in computer science or similar degree
* Experience working as a Manager for a Tech Team
* Working in different contexts and organisations
* Interest in leadership and developing teams
* Proficient in English, both verbal and written
* Business minded and able to see the big picture
* A natural leader who is caring and inspiring
* Able to communicate clearly, both with your team and stakeholders
* Well organized and goal oriented


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: AI Backend Developer
description:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity to work with Generative AI-driven solutions, where you can leverage your backend and cloud expertise while continuing to grow?
   

  

 We are an agile, DevOps team, fully cloud native working with multiple clouds, develop applications using modern design patterns such as microservices. Reliability, security and observability are core values, DevEx is important, and we eagerly explore the use of Gen AI tools to support our development.
   

  

 We already built and launched multiple Gen AI products, utilizing LLMs, speech, vision and embedding models, RAG based and others, and are continuously exploring new and upcoming technology. Join our team in Stockholm, Sweden, and be part of a collaborative culture that empowers you to shape cutting-edge solutions and advance your career.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our AI Backend Developer**
 As an AI Backend Developer, you will play a key role in building scalable and secure AI-driven backend solutions. You will work closely with our team of engineers in Stockholm, and will play a key role in delivering AI-driven solutions that meet the evolving needs of our business and customers.
   

  

 Your responsibilities would include:
   

  

* Designing and implementing robust backend architectures using cloud technologies
* Developing and maintaining scalable microservices and APIs
* Develop secure, performant, and reliable solutions
* Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions effectively
* Working with DevOps practices to streamline deployment and infrastructure management
* Staying up to date with advancements in AI, backend development, and cloud computing


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has strong hands-on experience in backend development with cloud infrastructure expertise
* Has worked with microservices, containers, and databases (SQL & NoSQL)
* Understands and can integrate Generative AI solutions into backend architectures
* Has experience working in a DevOps team within an agile environment
* Is fluent in English, both spoken and written
* Merit: Hands-on experience with Python, Azure, OpenAI APs


**What we offer:**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way.
* The opportunity to develop your career in a respected global group.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Flexible working and wellness benefits.
* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. The recruitment process also includes standard personnel security clearance for the selected candidate. If you have any questions about the role or about the recruitment process, please email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at Khalil.kabakibi@assabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: C/C++ Embedded Software Developer - Stockholm Industry
company_industry: Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, Telecommunications, and Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
**Are you passionate about embedded systems and eager to work with cutting-edge technology?** 




 We are seeking enthusiastic C/C++ Embedded Software Developers to join our vibrant embedded systems team at ALTEN Stockholm - Industry. If you're ready to take the next step in your career and work on exciting projects, we'd love to hear from you!
 



  





**What We Offer You** 




 At ALTEN, every individual is equally valuable in building tomorrow’s world today. Here's what you can expect when you join our team:
 



  




* **Technological Challenges:** 
 Engage in innovative projects across various industries, including Automotive, Telecom, Energy, Aviation, Defense, and Life Sciences.
* **Career Development:** 
 Influence your own development with a wide range of assignments. Benefit from personalized training opportunities through your individual training budget, usable in our internal
 **ALTEN Academy** 
 or on external courses.
* **Inspiring Togetherness:** 
 Join internal networks like
 **ALTEN Sports** 
 and
 **Women@ALTEN** 
 . Participate in our
 **Tech Weeks** 
 to share experiences and learn what your colleagues are working on.
* **Work-Life Balance:** 
 Enjoy three extra days off per year. We offer benefits like pension plans, insurance, and wellness grants, all under a collective agreement.
* **Coaching Leadership:** 
 Our leaders will guide you in the right direction with supportive and coaching leadership.
* **Contribute to a Sustainable Future:** 
 Be part of projects that aim to create a sustainable future.



  





**Your Role as a C/C++ Embedded Software Developer** 




 As a member of our team, you will:
 



  




* **Develop Embedded Software:** 
 Design, implement, and test embedded software solutions using C/C++.
* **Collaborate Across Disciplines:** 
 Work closely with hardware engineers, firmware developers, and cross-functional teams to develop state-of-the-art technology.
* **Innovate and Solve Problems:** 
 Tackle technical challenges and contribute innovative solutions in embedded systems.
* **Participate in Full Development Cycle:** 
 Be involved from concept phase to product delivery, ensuring high-quality results.
* **Maintain High Standards:** 
 Ensure your code meets the highest standards of quality and performance.



  





**Who We Are Looking For** 




 We are seeking individuals who are positive, outgoing, and eager to learn. You should be a team player with excellent communication skills and the ability to build strong relationships with colleagues and clients. A genuine passion for technology and a desire to contribute to ALTEN’s success are essential.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* **Education:** 
 Master's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* **Experience:** 
 Minimum of three years' experience developing embedded software in C/C++.



  





**Skills:** 



* Proficiency in C/C++ programming for embedded systems.
* Familiarity with embedded development tools and environments.



  





**Meritorious:** 



* Experience with Jenkins or Python.



  





**Other:** 



* European citizenship is required.



  





**About ALTEN** 




 ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest technology and IT consulting companies with over 57,000 employees in nearly 30 countries. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the value chain of the most prestigious companies in all sectors, such as Automotive, Defense, Energy & Environment, Industry, Public services & Government and Life Sciences. In Sweden, we are about 1300 committed employees with 9 offices in 9 cities - from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north.
 



  





 For the fifth year in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden's most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

title: Junior Automation Software Developer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you a Software Developer with a special interest in automation and network solutions? Do you want to use your experience to make better things happen? My name is Mikko Keppo and I run the Network Automation in Telia. We are now looking for a Junior Automation Software Developer to join and strengthen our team.
   

  

 We are a team of professionals with both operational and development responsibilities. We share a common vision to improve and simplify processes and products through automation.
   

  

 Evaluating commercial products, make or buy options, learning new technologies and putting them to the test is our normal approach to challenges we face.
   

  

**Are you ready to make things happen?**
 In the role as Junior Automation Software Developer you will be a part of the Infrastructure Automation Team at Telia. This team maintains and develops a platform that enables network automation, including service activation and life cycle management across Telia’s footprint in the Nordics and Baltic countries.
   

  

 In this position you will be responsible for the technical development in the system. You will be focusing on setting up and managing automation processes and data modelling, as well as defining and documenting the processes in the system. Together with internal and external stakeholders you will lead operational and development activities across the organization.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 To be successful in this position we believe you are a Software Developer with a mix of software architecture, CI/CD experience, and IP network knowledge. You have hands-on experience of languages such as Python and/or Java, as well as knowledge of tools like git, github and docker. As a person you are curious when it comes to new tools and ideas, and have a natural way of communicating this on different levels. Big plus, but not a must, if you have experience in network automation platforms e.g. Cisco NSO
   

  

**Your Experience:**
* Software development in Python or similar object oriented language like Java or Go
* Experience with automation and/or CI/CD processes such as ansible, Jenkins, github actions etc
* Familiar with networking protocols and concepts, service provider experience and knowledge a big plus
* Experience with network automation protocols such as Netconf, YANG and/or SNMP is a plus.
* A desire to learn new technologies
* Fluent in English both spoken and in writing


**More than just a job!**
 No matter what job you are looking for with us, we give you the tools and support you need to manage your personal development. We want to help you develop both on a personal level and in your professional role. With us, you become part of a creative, motivating and welcoming company where everyone can be themselves, with equal opportunities to develop. We respect people and value diversity. In addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we offer flexibility and a wide range of different benefits.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Helsinki or Oslo
   

  

**Interested?**
 Don't hesitate to send in your application if you want to be part of our team! Selection takes place continuously. Last application date is
 **2025-03-10** 
 .
   

  

 If you want to know more about the job, you are welcome to contact manager, Mikko Keppo mikko.keppo@teliacompany.com.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application. In order to handle your personal data securely, we ask you to apply via our recruitment system. We are unable to accept applications via e-mail or other channels. Background checks take place in our recruitment processes.
   

  

**Welcome to Telia - Let's make better happen!**

title: Ruby Developer
description:
**At Hemnet, we offer the opportunity to work on a wide range of challenges, from building scalable systems that handle high traffic to crafting payment solutions and contributing to domain modeling. You’ll be involved in every stage of the product development lifecycle—whether it's ideation, innovation, new development, or iteration. Your work will directly impact millions of users, as we deploy updates multiple times a day.**
 We run both Node.js and Rails applications in production, emphasizing the right tool for the job. Our tech stack includes OpenSearch, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, and Docker, among others. On the frontend, React is our go-to framework, paired with Next.js and TypeScript. We rely on AWS, using both Terraform and AWS CDK for hosting.
   

  

**How We Work**
**🧪 Embrace the Unknown – The Adventure Awaits! 🧪**
 At Hemnet, we love to experiment. With our vast user base, we can never predict exactly what our users will love. That's where you come in! Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all.
   

  

**⚗️ Lab Week: Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist! ⚗️**
 Twice a year, we dedicate a Lab Week where you’ll have the freedom to explore exciting experiments. It’s your chance to dive into your own projects, explore new ideas, and share your results with the team. Innovation starts here!
   

  

**⚙️ Test, Test, and Test – Safety First! ⚙️**
 Delivering a high-performance experience is core to our development process. We prioritize rigorous automated testing to ensure the reliability and stability of our applications.
   

  

**👯 Pair Programming and Mob Sessions – Because We're Stronger Together 👯**
 We believe in the power of collaboration. Through pair programming and mob sessions, we combine our strengths, solve challenges, and share knowledge across teams.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for an experienced Web Developer with a minimum of four years of professional experience building customer-facing applications in Ruby on Rails. In this role, you will primarily build and maintain backend services and contribute to impactful user features. You’re comfortable working across various technologies and frameworks, always choosing the best solution for the task at hand. If you thrive in a collaborative environment and love to innovate, this role is for you.
   

  

**Qualities We Look For**
* You have proven experience in software development, with a strong portfolio showcasing products you have worked on. You have a pragmatic and agile approach to software development, balancing quality and business needs.
* You are an effective communicator with skills and tools to collaborate within cross-functional teams.
* You take responsibility for both your growth and the development of those around you, always eager to learn and share new knowledge.


****Your career at Hemnet****
 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working**
 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Senior Software Developer
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**At Billogram, we like to be the good guys of billing—making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments.** 
 We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and instead be beneficial to both our clients and their customers—improving their relationships.
 



  





 To support our growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market, we are looking for a talented
 **Senior Software Developer** 
 with a background in payments to help us get there.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 We’re looking for a Python Developer who’s excited by the challenge of rethinking how billing gets done. If you love collaborating with a diverse team, finding new angles to solve problems, and making an impact on real customer experiences, you’ll fit right in. You’ll join a friendly crew of developers, product managers, and other stakeholders who share a passion for building a platform that treats people well — and proves that great business grows from great relationships.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Standardize & Scale:** 
 Help shape a platform that’s ready to grow into new European markets. You’ll refactor, optimize, and test our systems so they can handle more transactions and delight more users.
* **Tackle Tech Debt:** 
 Fine-tune existing solutions so they run smoothly for larger clients, higher traffic, and increased complexity.
* **Create Real Value:** 
 Dive into coding, requirement analysis, and testing to build features that our clients — and their customers — will love.
* **Learn & Collaborate:** 
 Work side by side with other developers, share fresh ideas and keep our platform moving forward.



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 




 We want someone
 **humble, hungry, and happy** 
 : eager to grow, curious about how things can improve, and excited about shaping the future of billing. You enjoy discussing big ideas but are also comfortable rolling up your sleeves to make them happen.
 



  





**Key Qualifications** 



* **Python Expertise:** 
 At least 4 years of professional experience, ideally working on products with real-world impact.
* **Payments Experience** 
 : A couple of years (or more) dealing with payment systems, transactions, or other financial services.
* **Adaptability:** 
 Familiarity with PHP and an openness to learning new languages.
* **Product Mindset:** 
 Comfortable in a collaborative, product-focused environment, where everyone’s ideas matter.



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* **B2B & B2C Background:** 
 Experience building solutions for business and consumer needs.
* **Scaling Know-How** 
 : Exposure to international expansion or platforms that operate across borders.



  





**Why work with us?** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges and a whole lot of laughs.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



  





**Welcome to the world of Billogram!**

title: Lead Fullstack Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Lead Fullstack Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment?
 



  





 Are you based in Sweden with ability to work on-site with our clients in the Stockholm area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Lead Fullstack Developer** 




  





 As a Lead Fullstack Developer, you will play a pivotal role as both a consultant/client advisor, and a hands-on developer. Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



 Your role as a consultant/client advisor will not only entail providing technical knowledge but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



  





 Assignments and clients vary, but our main aim is to always make great high-quality customer experiences that last. We achieve this by using technical solutions that add value, not just for our clients, but also for their customers.
 



  





 In addition, you will:
 


* Act as a trusted advisor to our clients, offering guidance and solutions to address their business needs
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy fullstack solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle
* Engage with our clients' stakeholders from both IT and Business aligning our solutions to provide business value
* Understand the client business and challenges
* Guide the client into decision making
* See the holistic view of an assignment and not just your part
* Within you leadership, have the ability to develop others and help them grow within their role
* Work in bigger and complex projects.



  





**You and the role** 




  





 You are a skilled full-stack developer with at least 7 years of experience working across both front-end and back-end technologies. You're comfortable navigating diverse tech stacks, and you take pride in writing clean, maintainable code.
 



 You enjoy collaborating with various stakeholders, both internal and external, and fellow developers, translating business requirements into technical solutions that add value. With a passion for learning and staying current with industry trends, you’re eager to contribute to dynamic projects while continuously growing your skill set.
 



 We would love if you have
 


* At least 7 years of experience in fullstack development, with hands-on experience in modern frameworks and technologies
* A proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* A willingness to move freely within the entire technology stack and experience working in agile working environment
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Fluency in Swedish and English



  





**Your technical skills should include:** 



* .NET Core /C#, Node.js
* React, TypeScript, Vue
* Headless CMS architectures and technologies
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence



  





**Bonus if you also have:** 



* Experience or strong interest in Angular and Ruby on Rails
* CMS/eCommerce platforms like Sitecore, Adobe, Optimizely, etc.
* A cloud provider like Azure or AWS



  





**What you can expect from us** 




 Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop.
 
 Read more about life at Valtech here.
 





 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.
 




  





**Join Valtech** 




  





 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.

title: Senior Software Engineer
company_industry: Business Consulting and Services and Software Development
description:
**Polygon – Always by your side** 




 Polygon is a major worldwide player in property damage control, providing solutions to prevent control and mitigate all kinds of property damage. The basis for their success is their +8,000 committed employees, guided by a strong corporate culture. They see themselves as the new generation of Property Damage Control specialists – determined to drive industry transformation.
 



  





  





 Learn more about Polygon here
 
 ; https://www.polygongroup.com/en-GB
 
 /
 



  





 Polygon Digital Solutions is a service line within Polygon Group responsible for development, sales, and delivery of tech-based proactive solutions for insurance, managed property, and construction. The solutions combine IoT and data analysis to monitor conditions in buildings and construction environments to reduce the risk of property damage to save health, environment, and costs. The team is currently 35 people and based in Stockholm, Sweden and Worcester, UK.
 



  





 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer, based in Stockholm to join the dynamic development team of about10 engineers based in Stockholm, Sweden and Worcester, UK. The team operates as part of a product-focused group, collaborating closely with a dedicated Test Engineer and Product Manager to deliver high-quality web and mobile applications.
 



  





**The role:** 




 Reporting to the Technical Director, you will work closely with the Tech Lead on a day-to-day basis. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will contribute to the development of the IoT platform, with focus on the web platform and mobile apps for iOS and Android. You will play a key role in mentoring team members, improving development practices, and shaping the future of Polygon Digital Solutions technology.
 



  





 The stack includes React, Next.js, and React Native for application development, with infrastructure powered by AWS (including early-stage use of AWS IoT Core), Terraform, Docker,and Kubernetes. They also leverage Kafka, TimescaleDB, and Redis for backend systems. Additionally, the devices use a range of connectivity types, including WiFi, cellular, and LoRa.
 



  





 Some of your responsibilities will be;
 



 · design, develop, and deploy scalable web and mobile applications using React, Next.js, and React Native.
 



 · Contribute to architectural decisions, ensuring maintainable and efficient code across platforms.
 



 · Manage and optimize infrastructure using AWS, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.
 



 · Support and enhance backend systems leveraging Kafka, TimescaleDB, and Redis
 



 · Actively participate in Agile ceremonies and contribute to a culture of continuous improvements.
 



  





**Your profile:** 




 We are looking for you, who have +10 years’ experience of software development, with a strong focus on React, Next.js and React Native. You also have hands-on experience with AWS infrastructure and services. Have you been espoused to AWS IoT Core its a plus.
 



  





 Polygon´s devices use a range of connectivity types, including WiFi, cellular, and LoRa. While direct experience in these areas is not essential, familiarity with IoT systems, AWS IoT Core, and connected devices is highly desirable.
 



  





 Strong communication skills and exposure to ‘true’ Agile practices are essential for this role. Ideally you will actively participate in, and even help facilitate, Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, retrospectives, and stand-ups. A collaborative mindset and ability to interact effectively with stakeholders will also be key to success. Fluent English, both written and spoken is a must.
 



  





**Polygon offers:** 




 Working at Polygon gives you the opportunity to be part of a company that always puts people first. The dedication and knowledge of Polygon´s employees are crucial to their success, and they do everything to make the employees job easier. This is ensured by their simple organization and flat structure, with clear accountability.
 



  





 You will be an important part of an international and diverse company that continually grows. Polygon offers competitive salaries and a range of great benefits.
 



  





**Application:** 




 Polygon is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Please note that Polygon do not have a visa sponsorship program.
 



  





 In this recruitment process, Polygon International collaborates with Salesgroup. If you have any questions, please call 08-26 20 00. We apply ongoing selection in this recruitment process and therefore welcome your application as soon as possible.

title: Lead Frontend Developer

 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment?
 



 Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Are you fluent in Swedish? Then you might be the person we’re looking for!
