title: Product Owner within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1 000 employees in several countries.
  
  

What is Clinical Decision Support? CDS is an area of health information technologies that combines evidence-based knowledge and different kinds of patient data in order to generate and present helpful information to clinicians as care is being delivered. We develop standards-based, EHR-independent Clinical Decision Support (CDS) applications that aim to accelerate the learning and innovations of healthcare. At Cambio CDS, we are all passionate about improving healthcare by developing software tools to facilitate clinical decision-making at point of care. After initial success in Sweden and other countries, we anticipate a steady growth of the operation in the coming years. The position Are you passionate about healthcare? Do you want to contribute to the lives of millions? If your answers to both are true, the Cambio CDS team is the right place for you. We are looking for product owners to help us reach new heights. Your main responsibilities include the following:
  
Author and maintain functional requirements, risk analysis and end user facing documentation of our CDS apps.
  
Conduct user interviews, design workshops with clinicians as part of UX design of the CDS apps, in physical setting or remotely.
  
Participate in post-market surveillance and usability studies.
  
Lead and participate in CDS app UX design, clinical modelling, testing and releasing of CDS apps.
  
Perform demonstration of CDS apps with potential customers.
  
Provide training of CDS apps towards our customer representatives or partners.
  
Help the development of authoring tools and improve our app development process
  
  

At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee.Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeateeverything we do. About you As a person, you are a humble and responsible team player who loves problem solving. You pay attention to details and follow things through. You are open-minded, curious and keen to learn new skills. Like us, you are passionate about improving healthcare and motivated by the potentials of health IT.
  
Requirements
  
Excellent writing and oral skills in both English and Swedish
  
Clinical education/experience
  
Excel in working in team-based development
  
  

It's a bonus if you
  
Health informatics training
  
Experience with UX or usability studies
  
  

**Place of employment:** Stockholm
  
  

At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
  
**Scope:** Full time
  
**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
  
**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
  
We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work inSweden.We will ask for verification during the process.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!
  
Read more about us here!
  
Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site here!

title: Software Engineer within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries
  
What is Clinical Decision Support? CDS is an area of health information technologies that combines evidence-based knowledge and different kinds of patient data in order to generate and present helpful information to clinicians as care is being delivered. We develop standards-based, EHR-independent Clinical Decision Support (CDS) applications that aim to accelerate the learning and innovations of healthcare. At Cambio CDS, we are all passionate about improving healthcare by developing software tools to facilitate clinical decision-making at point of care.
  
The position Are you passionate about combining healthcare with software engineering? Do you want to contribute to the lives of millions? If your answers to both are true, the Cambio CDS team is the right place for you.
  
We are looking for software engineers to help us reach new heights. In this role, you will:
  
**Develop and Maintain:** Create and sustain cutting-edge clinical decision support tools within our diverse product portfolio.
  
**Server-Side Excellence:** Write efficient and robust server-side code to power our applications.
  
**Client-Side Innovation:** Design and implement seamless user interfaces using JavaScript and TypeScript.
  
**Embrace Learning:** Cultivate a growth mindset by exploring and integrating new technologies.
  
  

**Our Tech Stack includes:**  

**Containerization:** Docker and Kubernetes.
  
**Backend Technologies:** Java, Kotlin, and Spring Boot.
  
**Frontend Technologies:** JavaScript, TypeScript, Web Components, Lit, Vue.js.
  
  

At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee.Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeateeverything we do. About you As a person, you are a humble and responsible team player who loves problem-solving. You pay attention to details and follow things through. You are open-minded, curious and keen to learn new skills. Like us, you are passionate about improving healthcare and motivated by the potential of health IT. Requirements:
  
**Experience:** 3+ years in web development with a strong foundation in modern web technologies.
  
**Client-Side Expertise:** Proficient in CSS, HTML5, and JavaScript.
  
**Server-Side Proficiency:** Familiarity with enterprise-level technologies such as Java, Kotlin and Spring Boot.
  
**Language Skills:** Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
  
  

**It's a bonus if you have:**  

Experience in the healthcare industry.
  
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
  
Knowledge of microservices frameworks and system integration.
  
Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Vue.js or Lit.
  
Understanding of human-computer interaction, accessibility, UX, and graphic design principles.
  
  

**Place of employment:** Stockholm
  
At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
  
**Scope:** Full time
  
**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
  
**Other:** We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
  
We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work inSweden.We will ask for verification during the process.
  
We look forward to receiving your application!
  
Read more about us here!
  
Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site here!

title: Sportsbook Product Owner
description:
Sportsbook Product Owner - ComeOn Group
  
Are you a sports fanatic with a passion for betting? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment where user experience and innovation are at the heart of everything you do? If so, ComeOn Group is looking for a Sportsbook Product Owner to drive the development of our cutting-edge sportsbook product and deliver an exceptional betting experience to our players.
  
ComeOn Group in short
  
Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group offers 15 brands across multiple markets on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 550 talented employees across 7 main locations.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

As a Sportsbook Product Owner, you’ll be at the forefront of ComeOn’s sportsbook domain, ensuring compliance with regulations while delivering a user-first, seamless betting experience. Your key responsibilities will include:
  
Own & Shape the Sportsbook Product – Take full ownership of the sportsbook domain, from regulatory requirements to market trends and best practices.
  
Enhance the Betting Experience – Work closely with a dedicated cross-functional team to refine and improve the user journey, ensuring a smooth, hassle-free betting experience.
  
Define & Document Requirements – Transform business needs into clear, actionable requirements and acceptance criteria, collaborating with UX and key stakeholders.
  
Data-Driven Decision Making – Stay on top of user behavior, market trends, and analytics to ensure our sportsbook is always ahead of the game.
  
Agile Collaboration – Actively participate in squad ceremonies, refining processes, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
  
Align Vision & Strategy – Work with other Product Owners and key stakeholders to ensure consistency and alignment on vision, goals, and upcoming initiatives.
  
Transparent Communication – Keep all stakeholders informed with roadmap updates, demo sessions, and regular progress reports.
  
  

We’re searching for a driven and customer-focused individual with:
  
3+ years of experience in product ownership or product management roles.
  
Strong knowledge of the betting industry and a passion for sports.
  
Proven experience in a B2C customer-facing product, with a strong grasp of user experience.
  
Excellent UX/UI understanding and the ability to apply design best practices to sportsbook products.
  
Outstanding communication skills with developers, designers, and business stakeholders.
  
Fluency in English (written and verbal), with strong presentation abilities.
  
An Agile mindset, with experience in Scrum and Kanban methodologies.
  
Technical literacy, ensuring seamless collaboration with the development team.
  
A data-driven approach to decision-making and problem-solving.
  
Experience in an international company and working with multicultural teams.
  
A solution-oriented attitude and the ability to overcome challenges proactively.
  
Willingness to travel occasionally (approximately 1-2 times per year).
  
  

Why Join ComeOn Group?
  
A diverse, modern and inclusive workplace
  
Extensive insurance coverage, including private healthcare insurance
  
Private pension insurance via Söderberg & Partners
  
30 days of paid vacation per year
  
Wellness allowance of 5000 SEK per year
  
Top-up parental leave up to 90%
  
Breakfast at the office every day
  
A one-time allowance of 2500 SEK to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home
  
On top of our hybrid arrangement, up to 40 days per year to work fully remotely from anywhere in the world
  
Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
  
Fun company events, team activities and Friday beers
  
  

At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.

title: Product Designer (UX/UI) till en global kund i Stockholm!
description:
Är du en passionerad designer med öga för användarcentrerad design? Vi söker en expert inom UX/UI som vill vara med och skapa framtidens digitala upplevelser!
  
**Arbetsuppgifter Skapa intuitiva designlösningar:** Utforma användarvänliga gränssnitt med fokus på en sömlös upplevelse.
  
**Utveckla designprinciper:** Formulera och underhåll riktlinjer för att säkerställa enhetlig och högkvalitativ design.
  
**Samarbete:** Arbeta nära utvecklare och andra intressenter för att ständigt förbättra produkterna.
  
**Din profil Erfarenhet:** Minst 5 års erfarenhet som produktdesigner, UI/UX-designer eller liknande roll.
  
**Användarfokus:** Minst 3 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med produkter och tjänster riktade mot slutanvändare.
  
**Verktyg:** Erfarenhet av designverktyg såsom Figma, Sketch eller Adobe XD.
  
**Portfolio:** Ett starkt portfolio som visar din förmåga att skapa användarcentrerade lösningar.
  
**Metodik:** Kunskap inom wireframing, prototyping och användartester.
  
**Kommunikation:** Förmåga att motivera dina designbeslut med data och insikter.
  
Vår arbetsmiljö Du trivs i en dynamisk miljö där snabba förändringar är vardag.
  
Du är agil, självgående och tar gärna egna initiativ i produktutvecklingsdiskussioner.
  
Du inspireras av en start-up-liknande atmosfär där innovation och kreativitet uppmuntras.
  
Varför välja denna tjänst?
  
Här får du chansen att arbeta med spännande projekt och driva digital innovation på en global skala. Vi erbjuder en kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö där din expertis verkligen kommer till sin rätt.
  
  

**Praktisk information:**  

**Plats:** Stockholm
  
**Uppdragsperiod:** 17 mars 2025 – 31 december 2025
  
**Deadline:** Skicka in din ansökan senast den 25 feb 2025
  
Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.
  
Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Design Lead (UI/UX)
description:
Resourced is a fast-growing FashionTech startup supporting modern fashion brands find and manage production. We help brands such as Axel Arigato, Stronger, Veja, Icebug, Chimi, Eytys, Ralph Lauren, H&M (to name a few). Were digitally transforming one of the largest, fastest-moving industries in the world. By joining Resourced you will work in a truly global setting – we employ and work with clients on all continents.
  
We are looking for an talented Design Lead with a skillset spanning graphical design, interaction design and user experience who can continue our work on designing the most compelling PLM system (web application) in the industry.
  
We go to great lengths to build a product users truly love to use – a product that have great, well-thought-out UX that looks awesome! We pay big attention to details but still ensure to never get stuck and keep a good pace moving forward. You will work closely with both the tech team and business side, and utilize our strong relationship with, and insights into, our customers and users. We run a simple process using Figma, starting with rough wireframes, gradually enhancing them iteratively using internal and external feedback as needed until we’ve reached a great result.
  
To succeed as a designer at Resourced we believe you will need to fully immerse yourself with the problems we’re trying to solve and relentlessly seek the most beautiful solution – often using an outside-the-box perspective!
  
The job Take ownership and lead/drive our product development efforts; from idea, exploration and analysis to handover
  
Turn wireframes and ideas into great designs, ready for our software devs to develop
  
Provide clear specifications, in particular regarding interactivity
  
Efficiently explore and find creative solutions to UI/UX challenges
  
Work closely with both the tech team and the business side
  
Requirements A strong curiosity of how to build products and services that customers will embrace
  
Excellent graphic design skills – fluent in Figma, Adobe Illustrator and other design tools
  
Excellent and fluent in interface design, allowing you to work seamlessly with UI/UX design
  
Attention to detail and strong understanding of web application UX
  
Communicate clearly without any hinders
  
Proven track record of designing successful products – in particular complex web applications (which you undertake with ease)
  
Nice-to-haves Frontend web development experience/skills
  
A degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s) in interaction design, industrial design, or equivalent
  
Background in the fashion industry
  
  

We’re all about finding a person who can deliver the right results – not the right resume!
  
What we offerA unique opportunity to join an early-stage startup and a small team, become highly influential on what we build, and grow your career alongside the company!
  
Competitive salary and compensation package
  
Work with a team who believes in having fun while working!
  
Work for users who really cares about beauty in their digital tools!
  
And of course, the hardware and environment you desire in order to do your best work possible!
  
  

**Start date:** ASAP Work extent: Full time Location: Gothenburg (Gårda), on-site
  
**Contact:** Felicia Ringblom, Tech Team Lead @ felicia@resourced.com / 0704415997

title: Product Designer UX/UI to Fashion Retail Company
description:
Are you a product designer looking for an exciting full-time opportunity starting asap? Join an innovative team in the fashion retail industry (based in Stockholm), where you'll play a key role in designing and improving digital products that reach millions of users worldwide. This is a full-time consulting assignment running from March to 31st December 2025, based in the Stockholm office with possibility to work hybrid or remote.
  
**About the role:** As a Product Designer, you will be responsible for crafting intuitive and visually appealing design solutions that enhance the user experience. You will collaborate closely with developers and stakeholders to refine and optimize products while maintaining a consistent design language across platforms. Working in an agile and fast-moving environment, you will have the opportunity to drive innovation and influence product development decisions.
  
**Responsibilities:** Design intuitive and user-centered digital experiences, ensuring seamless interactions across platforms.
  
Develop and maintain design principles and guidelines to ensure consistency and scalability.
  
Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs using industry-standard tools.
  
Conduct user testing and incorporate insights to refine design solutions.
  
Work closely with developers to ensure feasibility and alignment with technical requirements.
  
Collaborate with stakeholders to iterate on designs and align with business objectives.
  
Contribute to a dynamic and agile work environment, adapting to rapid changes and new challenges.
  
  

**About you:**  

You are an experienced Product Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing user-centered design solutions. With a deep understanding of UI/UX principles, you excel at translating complex ideas into intuitive and visually compelling designs. You are comfortable working in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment and enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams to create impactful digital products.
  
**Experience and skills:** 5+ years of experience as a Product Designer, UI/UX Designer, or in a similar role.
  
3+ years of experience designing end-user products and services.
  
Proficiency in Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD for wireframing, prototyping, and design execution.
  
Strong understanding of user-centered design principles for both mobile and web applications.
  
Experience conducting user testing and applying insights to improve designs.
  
Ability to develop and maintain design systems and guidelines.
  
Strong communication skills, with the ability to justify design decisions using data and insights.
  
Comfortable working in an agile environment with rapid iterations and evolving requirements.
  
  

Does this sound like you? Apply today and make sure to include your portfolio!
  
  

About the assignment
  
For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.

title: Campaign & Content Specialist - Sthlm
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
 Are you passionate about creating compelling content that drives engagement and sales? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where creativity meets strategic execution? Join us at Strawberry as we take our digital campaigns to the next level!
   

  

 As our Campaign & Content Specialist, you’ll play a crucial role in shaping how Strawberry’s campaigns come to life within the Spenn ecosystem. You’ll be responsible for creating, adapting, and optimizing content that attracts, engages, and converts users within the Spenn app and website.
   

  

 This is your chance to join us at an exciting time—with the launch of Spenn, our new loyalty currency in partnership with Norwegian Air Shuttle, we are redefining how members earn and redeem rewards. Your work will be instrumental in ensuring that our offers and campaigns are clearly presented, commercially optimized, and backed by data-driven insights to engage the right audience in the most effective way.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

 You will create engaging, sales-driven, and conversion-optimized content that enhances the visibility of Strawberry’s campaigns within Spenn. Your work will directly contribute to driving digital sales and increasing user engagement. You will also play a key role in shaping and improving the content strategy for Spenn, ensuring that campaigns are both compelling and commercially effective, while leveraging data insights to refine messaging and optimize engagement.
   

  

 No two days will be the same—you will need to craft content across multiple platforms and formats, adapting tone and style to fit different audiences and needs. From campaign messaging to UX content, your ability to create clear, inspiring, and action-driving communication will be essential.
   

  

 Who we are looking for:
   

  

 We believe you are a creative and commercially driven content expert who understands how to capture attention, spark engagement, and drive sales through smart and strategic content. You have a strong ability to balance creativity with business goals, ensuring that every campaign you work on delivers both inspiration and measurable results.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* Experience in digital content creation and campaign execution within e-commerce, loyalty, or digital marketing.
* A data-driven mindset, using insights to refine content and improve conversions.
* A deep understanding of conversion-driven messaging and digital storytelling.
* Experience collaborating cross-functionally with product teams, UX, marketing and digital sales to enhance user experiences.
* Knowledge of SEO, content performance tracking, and CMS systems (we use Contentful).
* Excellent writing and communication skills in Norwegian or Swedish, as well as English (additional Nordic languages are a plus!).


 What we can offer you:
   

  

* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
* The chance to be part of a passionate team with exceptional colleagues and an inclusive culture, that believes every stay should be a story worth telling.
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family!
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.


 Details:
   

  

 We are recruiting two Campaign & Content Specialists, one for the Brand & Content Marketing team and one for the E-commerce team, we'll tell you more about it during the recruitment process. We offer a hybrid workplace. For this position, your base could be either in Oslo or Stockholm, hence the two ads. Some travel may be required between our main offices in Stockholm and Oslo.
   

  

 Sounds interesting?
   

  

 We'd love to hear from you! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application!

title: Product Owner within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1 000 employees in several countries.*
**What is Clinical Decision Support?**
 CDS is an area of health information technologies that combines evidence-based knowledge and different kinds of patient data in order to generate and present helpful information to clinicians as care is being delivered.
   

  

 We develop standards-based, EHR-independent Clinical Decision Support (CDS) applications that aim to accelerate the learning and innovations of healthcare. At Cambio CDS, we are all passionate about improving healthcare by developing software tools to facilitate clinical decision-making at point of care. After initial success in Sweden and other countries, we anticipate a steady growth of the operation in the coming years.
   

  

**The position**
 Are you passionate about healthcare? Do you want to contribute to the lives of millions? If your answers to both are true, the Cambio CDS team is the right place for you.
   

  

 We are looking for product owners to help us reach new heights. Your main responsibilities include the following:
   

  

* Author and maintain functional requirements, risk analysis and end user facing documentation of our CDS apps.
* Conduct user interviews, design workshops with clinicians as part of UX design of the CDS apps, in physical setting or remotely.
* Participate in post-market surveillance and usability studies.
* Lead and participate in CDS app UX design, clinical modelling, testing and releasing of CDS apps.
* Perform demonstration of CDS apps with potential customers.
* Provide training of CDS apps towards our customer representatives or partners.
* Help the development of authoring tools and improve our app development process


 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 As a person, you are a humble and responsible team player who loves problem solving. You pay attention to details and follow things through. You are open-minded, curious and keen to learn new skills. Like us, you are passionate about improving healthcare and motivated by the potentials of health IT
 **.**
**Requirements** 
  

  

* Excellent writing and oral skills in both English and Swedish
* Clinical education/experience
* Excel in working in team-based development


**It's a bonus if you**
* Health informatics training
* Experience with UX or usability studies


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Senior Product Manager (12 month FTC)
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
****About the Team:****
 The Audience Connect team is a newly formed team at King, responsible for shaping the audience and marketing technology strategy across all platforms. Our mission is to equip game teams with the tools, data, and strategies needed to deliver consistent, seamless, and impactful player conversations. By driving capabilities that unify and expand audiences across marketing, ads, and games, we aim to enable a new standard for audience engagement and growth.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As Senior Product Manager for the Audience Connect team, you will be instrumental in shaping and delivering the strategy, tools, and processes that enable King’s game teams to manage, grow, and engage player audiences more effectively. Reporting directly to the Sr. Director of Audience Connect, you will lead cross-functional collaboration, oversee key Marketing Technology initiatives, and ensure alignment with King’s broader business goals. You’ll work closely with engineering teams across the organization to ensure seamless implementation and measurable impact.
   

  

 We are looking to hire this role as a 12 month FTC.
   

  

****Key Responsibilities:****
****Product Strategy & Roadmap:****
* Define and maintain a clear product vision and roadmap for audience management tools and technologies, ensuring alignment with team objectives.
* Evaluate opportunities for business impact and strategic alignment; collaborate with engineering, UX, and stakeholders to develop optimal solutions


****Stakeholder Collaboration:****
* Partner with Consumer Marketing, Performance Marketing, Ads, Technology, and game teams to identify needs, challenges, and opportunities.
* Serve as the primary liaison between business and technical teams, driving alignment and clear communication.


****MarTech Leadership:****
* Drive the evaluation, adoption, and optimization of marketing technology platforms, such as customer data, engagement and attribution platforms.
* Collaborate with external vendors to ensure solutions meet business needs and maximize ROI.


****Analytics & Insights:****
* Define KPIs and reporting frameworks to measure the success of audience management initiatives.
* Leverage analytics and A/B testing to inform decisions and drive continuous improvement.


****Team Enablement:****
* Develop playbooks and training materials to empower decentralized teams to manage audiences and use MarTech independently.
* Foster collaboration and knowledge sharing across teams to establish best practices.


****Qualifications:****
* Experience: 5+ years of product management experience, ideally within MarTech, AdTech, or a data-driven environment.
* Leadership: Proven ability to manage complex cross-functional initiatives and influence stakeholders at all levels.
* Technical Expertise: Strong knowledge of marketing technologies, audience segmentation, and data platforms. Experience with tools like Braze, mParticle, and Appsflyer is a plus.
* Strategic Thinking: Ability to translate business goals into actionable product strategies and roadmaps.
* Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to distill complex topics into clear, actionable insights.
* Collaboration: Proven track record of driving alignment and fostering collaboration across diverse, matrixed teams.
* Problem Solving: Strong analytical mindset with the ability to identify issues, troubleshoot effectively, and implement solutions.


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Complex Visualization Developer (Front End Engineer)
description:
We are urgently looking for a frontend developer to create a proof-of-concept for a revolutionary visual programming environment that combines natural language with dynamic block composition - a system where
 **blocks intelligently adapt based on context and zoom level** 
 . This project initially focuses on trading strategies but with broader applications. We need someone who can make complex systems feel intuitive without tutorials.
 



  





**Apply with portfolio and a few lines on your fit and motivation to** 
**ahmed@batonics.com** 




  





**Required** 



* an impressive portfolio
* a fast and strong coder



  





**Preferable** 
 :
 


* Sweden or EU resident
* Beyond front-end/UX - fullstack-ish
* Familiarity with cursor, v0, replit, and other AI tools
* Experience in designing dynamic visualization systems that adapt to complexity like intelligent zoom
* Available immediately
* Experience with color theory, relationship highlighting, progressive disclosure in complex interfaces
* Experience in semantic zooming , contextual detail management, auto-grouping/coalescence of components
* Interest in joining long-term as a core team member



  





  





**Compensation** 
 : Hourly based for the first 3 months
 



  





**Interview and Assessment** 
 : We'll have a multi-hour assessment task as part of the selection process, if it'll be used in our work we'll pay upto 4,000 SEK for it.
 



  





**Batonics AB** 
 : We're building a system that democratizes complex data operations through intuitive visual programming - making institutional-grade tools accessible without sacrificing power. The interface you create will evolve into a platform that maintains its lightweight feel whether handling 3 blocks or 3000, requiring no tutorials while enabling powerful compositions. This could revolutionize how people interact with data and algorithms across multiple domains.

title: Loyalty Campaign Manager - Sthlm
description:
*We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*
 Are you passionate about driving commercially successful campaigns that enhance customer loyalty and retention? If so, this is your opportunity to take ownership of loyalty initiatives and campaign performance within the Spenn ecosystem!
   

  

 At Strawberry, we are redefining loyalty with the launch of Spenn, our new loyalty currency in partnership with Norwegian Air Shuttle. We are creating a seamless and rewarding experience for our members, where they can earn and redeem rewards faster than ever before. As our Loyalty Campaign Manager, you will be at the heart of this transformation—developing campaigns and content strategies that not only engage and convert users but also drive long-term loyalty.
   

  

 What you will be doing:
   

  

 In this role, you will be responsible for creating, adapting, and optimizing campaigns, offers and content that clearly communicates Strawberry’s loyalty offerings within the Spenn app and website. You will ensure that our campaigns are compelling, data-driven, and strategically aligned to increase engagement, encourage repeat business, and enhance retention.
   

  

* Lead and manage loyalty-focused campaigns—from brief creation to execution, ensuring seamless collaboration between teams.
* Develop and refine content strategies that effectively communicate member benefits, rewards, and incentives within Spenn.
* Leverage data insights to optimize messaging and identify opportunities for increased engagement, retention, and customer lifetime value.
* Create content tailored to different customer segments, ensuring a personalized and engaging loyalty experience.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Brand & Content Marketing, E-commerce, UX, and Digital Sales to ensure consistent messaging and optimal positioning of loyalty campaigns.
* Track and analyze content performance, using A/B testing and insights to continuously improve campaign effectiveness.
* Educate and inspire internal stakeholders about how content and loyalty work together to drive engagement and business growth.


 Who we are looking for:
   

  

 We believe you are a strategic and commercially driven loyalty expert with a strong understanding of customer engagement and retention. You have experience leading projects and initiatives that enhance loyalty programs, ensuring campaigns are well-executed, data-driven, and commercially effective. With a keen eye for customer behavior and business growth, you know how to design and optimize campaigns that resonate with both new and returning customers, ultimately strengthening brand loyalty and increasing long-term value.
   

  

 We believe you have:
   

  

* Experience in content creation and campaign execution, within loyalty, CRM, e-commerce, or digital marketing.
* A strong understanding of loyalty and retention strategies, including how to increase engagement and customer lifetime value.
* Project management experience, with the ability to lead campaigns from start to finish.
* A data-driven mindset, using insights to refine messaging, segment audiences, and improve conversion rates.
* Hands-on experience with content performance tracking, A/B testing, and optimization.
* Knowledge of SEO, content analytics, and CMS systems (we use Contentful).
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, as you’ll be working closely with multiple teams.
* Fluency in Norwegian or Swedish, as well as English (additional Nordic languages are a plus!).


 What we can offer you:
   

  

* A flat organization with trust and autonomy in your work. We are rebels that support innovation without imposing strict corporate rules.
* The chance to be part of a passionate team with exceptional colleagues and an inclusive culture, that believes every stay should be a story worth telling.
* Plenty of social events including smaller gatherings with your team and huge get-togethers with the whole Strawberry family!
* Great benefits! In addition to our collective agreement, we also offer staff discounts and friends & family rates at our 200+ hotels.


 Details:
   

  

 This role will be part of our Loyalty team. You will collaborate closely with the two Campaign & Content Specialists that we are also recruiting—one for Brand & Content Marketing and one for E-commerce.
   

  

 We offer a hybrid workplace, for this position, your base could be either in Oslo or Stockholm, hence the two ads. Some travel may be required between our main offices in Stockholm and Oslo.
   

  

 Sounds interesting?
   

  

 We'd love to hear from you! Interviews will be held on a rolling basis, don’t wait to submit your application!

title: Software Engineer within eHealth
description:
*Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in eHealth with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our eHealth solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries*
**What is Clinical Decision Support?**
 CDS is an area of health information technologies that combines evidence-based knowledge and different kinds of patient data in order to generate and present helpful information to clinicians as care is being delivered. We develop standards-based, EHR-independent Clinical Decision Support (CDS) applications that aim to accelerate the learning and innovations of healthcare. At Cambio CDS, we are all passionate about improving healthcare by developing software tools to facilitate clinical decision-making at point of care.
   

  

**The position**
 Are you passionate about combining healthcare with software engineering? Do you want to contribute to the lives of millions? If your answers to both are true, the Cambio CDS team is the right place for you.
   

  

 We are looking for software engineers to help us reach new heights. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop and Maintain: Create and sustain cutting-edge clinical decision support tools within our diverse product portfolio.
* Server-Side Excellence: Write efficient and robust server-side code to power our applications.
* Client-Side Innovation: Design and implement seamless user interfaces using JavaScript and TypeScript.
* Embrace Learning: Cultivate a growth mindset by exploring and integrating new technologies.


**Our Tech Stack Includes**
* Containerization: Docker and Kubernetes.
* Backend Technologies: Java, Kotlin, and Spring Boot.
* Frontend Technologies: JavaScript, TypeScript, Web Components, Lit, Vue.js.


 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 As a person, you are a humble and responsible team player who loves problem-solving. You pay attention to details and follow things through. You are open-minded, curious and keen to learn new skills. Like us, you are passionate about improving healthcare and motivated by the potential of health IT.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience: 3+ years in web development with a strong foundation in modern web technologies.
* Client-Side Expertise: Proficient in CSS, HTML5, and JavaScript.
* Server-Side Proficiency: Familiarity with enterprise-level technologies such as Java, Kotlin and Spring Boot.
* Language Skills: Fluent in English, both written and spoken.


**It's a Bonus If You Have**
* Experience in the healthcare industry.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of microservices frameworks and system integration.
* Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as Vue.js or Lit.
* Understanding of human-computer interaction, accessibility, UX, and graphic design principles.


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in
 **Sweden.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Rillion is seeking a skilled and enthusiastic Senior Data Engineer to join our innovative Data/AI team. In this role, you’ll be pivotal in developing and maintaining our data infrastructure that drives AI-powered AP (Accounts Payable) automation and providing valuable product insights based on usage data. Our team consists of two data engineers, an AI/machine learning lead, a data lead, a UX designer, a product manager, and three software engineers. Together, we collaborate across the entire product lifecycle - from brainstorming and design to implementation - unlocking AI’s potential in AP automation. If you’re a data enthusiast who thrives in a dynamic environment, we’d love to have you on board!
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Senior Data Engineer at Rillion, your responsibilities will include:
 


* Designing and implementing scalable data pipelines within an Azure cloud environment to ingest, process, and store large volumes of usage data, ensuring data quality and integrity.
* Improving and maintaining a Databricks-based data lakehouse, creating efficient data models tailored for AI and analytics needs.
* Establishing monitoring systems and data governance practices to ensure performance and compliance.
* Collaborating with software engineers to integrate AP automation data, with the mandate to decide between batch or streaming integration methods, based on what best fits the use case.



  





 Part of your role will involve mentoring junior engineers and fostering a culture of continuous learning, while working closely with the team to deliver end-to-end solutions that leverage data and AI to drive innovation in AP automation.
 



  





**What You'll Bring:** 



* 5 years of experience in the data engineering field
* Proficiency in SQL and Python
* Cloud experience, preferably with Azure
* Experience with orchestration tools such as Apache Airflow or Azure Data Factory
* Experience with data warehousing solutions, preferably Databricks
* Experience of event-driven architecture and role-based data access



  





**Bonus skills:** 



* Management/lead experience
* Familiarity with BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Terraform
* Contributions to open-source projects
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills



  





**What we offer:** 



* Opportunity to work in a dynamic growth company
* Talented colleagues ready to support the success in your career path
* Social events with your colleagues (breakfast, candy-time, afterwork etc.)
* A collection of different benefits, including a generous pension and insurance package
* Hybrid working model, 2 days per week in the office
* Come and enjoy our beautiful office in central Stockholm (on the 14th floor, with amazing views)



  





**The recruitment process:** 




 We review applications and invite for interviews continuously. A background check will be conducted on final candidates, pre-employment. If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact recruiter Victoria Stjernström at
 **victoria.stjernstrom@rillion.com** 




  





**About Rillion:** 




*We are a global company founded in Sweden with 30 years’ experience in the AP Automation industry. We help finance professionals transform how they manage invoices by digitalizing and automating the entire process.* 




  





*By removing the manual steps of invoice handling, we enable finance teams to save time and effort, reducing the possibility of human error. Because* 
 we’re AP professionals ourselves, we understand how to give our customers everything they need, and nothing they don’t.
 



  





*Together with our owners at Altor, we´re on a journey to expand in our home markets, while entering new territories. To complete our mission, we need more talented people!* 




  





*Rillion is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.*

title: Software Engineer Backend (Node.js, Fastify, TypeScript, Jest)
description:
We are seeking a **Backend Consultant** to assist our client in the development of backend applications and services for customer profiles. The consultant will be responsible for writing high-quality, scalable, and testable code while working in an agile and collaborative environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and maintain backend applications using **Node.js** and the **Fastify** framework.
* Work with **TypeScript** to ensure type safety and maintainable code.
* Build and consume **REST APIs**, integrating with databases as needed.
* Design and maintain **automated test suites** using **Jest** to ensure high code quality.
* Implement and maintain **CI/CD pipelines** for continuous integration and deployment.
* Utilize **GitHub Actions** for automation and **Terraform** for infrastructure management.
* Work with cloud platforms such as **GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure**.
* Participate in **code reviews**, provide feedback, and collaborate with the team.
* Follow agile methodologies, working independently and in collaboration with the team.

**Required Skills & Experience:**

* **Proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript** with hands-on experience in backend development.
* **Strong knowledge of Node.js and the Fastify framework** for building efficient APIs.
* Experience working with **REST APIs** and databases.
* **Expertise in Jest** for writing unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests.
* Familiarity with **CI/CD automation** and version control using **Git**.
* Understanding of **cloud infrastructure** and deployment strategies.
* Experience with **GitHub Actions and Terraform** for infrastructure and automation.
* Ability to work in a **fast-paced agile environment**, both independently and within a team.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with **GCP (preferred), AWS, or Azure**.
* Good understanding of **security best practices** in backend development.
* Experience in working with **microservices architecture**.

**Why Join Us?**

* Opportunity to work on a **high-impact projects.**
* Collaborative and agile work environment.
* Competitive compensation based on experience and expertise.

If you have the expertise in **Fastify, TypeScript, and automation testing (Jest)** and are passionate about building robust backend services, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Scrum master som är trygg i grunderna inom agilt arbetssätt
description:
Är du scrum master och vill jobba med team inom data och avancerad analys? Kom till oss på Finansinspektionen (FI) och bidra med din kompetens genom att utveckla våra team samt vårt agila arbetssätt! Vi jobbar målinriktat och engagerat för att öka datadrivet inom myndigheten. Nu förstärker vi vår organisation med en scrummaster.


**Om jobbet**



Som scrum master på avdelningen Data- och analysplattformar ingår du i ett eller flera agila team. Du arbetar tätt tillsammans med produktägaren och teammedlemmarna för att tillsammans skapa ett högpresterande team med en fokuserad, kvalitativ, säker och effektiv leverans. Du ansvarar för att facilitera ceremonier såsom standups, sprintplaneringar och retrospektiv. Du deltar också i utvecklingen av FI:s övergripande agila arbetssätt och leveransmodell. Du har stort fokus på att skapa ett bra och tryggt samarbetsklimat, att uppnå effektivitet i leveranserna samt att se till att teamets resultat, status och framdrift synliggörs.


**Din utbildning och erfarenhet**



Vi söker dig som


* har några års erfarenhet av att jobba som scrum master eller haft annan central agil roll
* är trygg i grunderna inom agilt arbetssätt
* har erfarenhet av att leda team och/eller initiativ
* tidigare arbetat med teamutveckling och coachning
* har utbildning inom it eller motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade på annat sätt
* uttrycker dig väl på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du


* har utbildning specifikt relaterat till agil leverans och agil certifiering
* har erfarenhet av att arbeta med ramverket SAFe eller liknande ramverk
* har erfarenhet av Azure DevOps
* har akademisk utbildning som civilingenjör, inom systemvetenskap eller annat tekniskt ämnesområde
* har erfarenhet från finansiell sektor och/eller offentlig sektor.


**Om dig**

I det här jobbet behöver du


* bidra till ett gott samarbete
* planera, organisera och prioritera ditt arbete på ett effektivt sätt
* kommunicera tydligt med olika målgrupper
* ta egna initiativ.


**Om FI**  

FI bidrar till ett stabilt finansiellt system, välfungerande marknader, en hållbar utveckling och ett högt skydd för konsumenter. Vi erbjuder dig att arbeta med samhällsviktiga uppgifter, där du är med och påverkar den finansiella marknaden.



På FI arbetar cirka 600 personer och våra värderingar präglas av att vi är engagerade, beslutsamma, målinriktade och hjälpsamma. Vår arbetsplats ligger centralt i Stockholm. Det finns även möjlighet att delvis arbeta på distans. För mer information om vår organisation: https://www.fi.se/sv/om-fi/organisation/



Verksamhetsområde It leder det strategiska digitaliseringsarbetet, driver innovation och ansvarar för internationell koordinering inom it. Vårt uppdrag är brett och vårt ansvarsområde sträcker sig från löpande drift, support och säkerhet till utveckling och förvaltning av våra system, projektledning, arkitektur, upphandlingar samt leverantörsstyrning. Här jobbar cirka 100 personer, fördelade på 5 avdelningar och en stab.



  

**Bra att veta**



Vi baserar vår rekrytering på kompetens. Det innebär att vi noggrant definierar vilka kvalifikationer som efterfrågas och sedan utgår från dem genom hela rekryteringsprocessen.



Vi arbetar aktivt för mångfald och likabehandling och välkomnar därför medarbetare med olika erfarenheter, bakgrunder och kompetenser.



Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.



Arbetspsykologiska tester kan ingå i rekryteringsprocessen.



På FI arbetar vi aktivt för att vara en attraktiv arbetsgivare där du som medarbetare trivs och utvecklas.



En anställning på FI kan innebära att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll görs enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen.


**Sök jobbet**



Välkommen med din ansökan som ska innehålla cv, personligt brev och relevanta intyg eller examensbevis.



Vi avböjer all hjälp med rekrytering och annonsering.

  



**Anställningsform:**

Tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.

  

  

**Omfattning:** Heltid
  

**Kontaktperson:**

Maria Strand Enkullen, Avdelningschef, 08-408 98 87 88

  


**Sista ansökningsdag:**



 2025-03-17

title: Solution Architect, ServiceNow
description:
Are you looking to be a go-to person for driving IT-strategic initiatives for one of the largest Nordic financial service providers? We are now looking for a person who is willing to take on a Nordic & Baltic role as a Solution Architect for ServiceNow implementation at If!
About the team
The IfNow platform team is a part of If IT and is responsible for the ServiceNow implementation at If. Our team focus on process improvements, problem solving and transformation projects that ranges in scope and business area. As a team our aim is to find the most effective way of working and by that continue to digitalize our business processes and increase usability.
Our team is located in Stockholm, Turku and Riga and we are a team with both developers and Solution Architects, supporting and giving value to our Business and IT.
Read more about our Tech Community at If and how we together create tech that matters: www.if.se/tech.
About the role
As Solution Architect we promise you an opportunity to drive and participate in fun and developing projects that will move If forward. You will also be exposed to all Business Areas and IT Units, as well as the wider architect community in the company. We promise to give you as much freedom as possible – including the accountability that comes with it.
You role is to drive the architectural design and development of ServiceNow for If IT and Business Areas, addressing questions such as:
What are the key areas where we can gain efficiency and create value for If by using solutions delivered by ServiceNow?* What is the best technical solution for a given business process?
* What is the future strategy of ServiceNow and how can it be utilized at If?
* Actively strive to realize the full value of the ServiceNow implementation.
* Ensure that new developed solutions adhere to best-practice and are built with long-term maintenance in consideration.

  

Technical lead for the ServiceNow platform providing:* Hands-on guidance of the development team
* Help Product Owners and Stakeholders to identify and request “most viable products” from the development team.
* Service Integration and Management


Driving efficiency initiatives within the ServiceNow Platform and the team.
Who are you?
In order to be successful in this role, we expect you to have the following qualifications:* 2-5 years` experience of ServiceNow development and architecture, preferably as a Solution Architect or Senior Developer.
* A proven problem solver with experience of structuring & analyzing business needs and putting together recommendations on how these needs can be met, using ServiceNow Out-of-box functionality and/or scoped applications.
* Experience working with multiple stakeholders to reconcile differing views into a common agenda, taking into account multiple perspectives and interests.
* Have broad technical knowledge with a curious mind/instinct wanting to continuously learn more. We also value forward thinking, visionary and driven mindset.
* Ability of building good relationships as well as having a positive and responsive attitude
* Able to communicate and collaborate effectively (vocally and visually) with both Business and IT colleagues.
* Dedicated to building an inspiring working environment.
* Fluent in English. Fluency in Nordic language is seen as a benefit due to internal communication with business mainly are in Nordic languages.


We offer
In the same way that we place some requirements on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.
Here are some of the benefits working at If:* An including and highly skilled professional work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career- and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g. wellness allowance and lunch benefit
* Great insurance benefits

Additional information and recruitment process
Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system and attach your CV and answer the questions on the application form. We will start screening and interviewing candidates already during the application period. Please notice that we are not able to handle any applications outside our recruitment system (Workday).
Application deadline: Last day to apply is 16th of March 2025.  

  

Location: Turku, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden.
Employment type: Permanent and full-time
Traveling: Some travel will be required since the role has responsibility throughout the countries in which If operates.
Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented. Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment.
If have any questions about the position, please contact Lena Kerfstedt, lena.kerfstedt@if.se.
We are eager to hear from you!
company_description: We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encourages of dreams.

title: IT-Projektledare
description:
Har du erfarenhet av projektledning, IT och infrastruktur? Inspireras du av att få jobba med flera spännande kunder där ditt jobb gör skillnad? Jag heter Anders Liljekow och jag ansvarar för vår fantastiska konsultgrupp i Malmö . Nu söker vi en ny kollega till vårt team som vill vara med på en tillväxt- och förändringsresa tillsammans med våra kunder mot en digital infrastruktur. Kanske är du vår nästa kollega?  



**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**

Som IT-Projektledare arbetar du nära våra kunder, vår säljorganisation och våra levererande organisationsdelar med att kvalitetssäkra och säkerställa ett strukturerat projektgenomförande. Du är en del i en grupp bestående av Projektledare och du kommer leda projekt av högt tekniskt innehåll. Till din hjälp har du våra IT-infrastrukturspecialister inom nätverk, säkerhet och hybrida IT-lösningar/ cloud .  



Exempel på det du kommer att göra:


* Planera, genomföra och styra viktiga kundprojekt enligt plan och budget med ett högt kvalitetstänk
* Medverka och driva vidareutvecklingen av våra processer för hur vi bedriver projekt
Agera rådgivande åt våra säljare i pågående dialoger avseende kommande projekt  

* 
Projektledning inom Telia Cygate:  



Dina framtida kollegor har gedigen erfarenhet från projektledning. I våra leveransprojekt arbetar vi utifrån en egenutvecklad projekt- och förändringsmetodik som bygger på vår erfarenhet från branschen och erkända standarder för projektledning. Men det är inte heller ovanligt att vi använder oss av våra kunders projektprocesser.  



**Är det här du?**

Att knyta nya kontakter och utveckla ditt professionella nätverk tror vi är naturligt för dig. Med ett öppet förhållningssätt skapar du en god atmosfär i dina projekt tillsammans med din projektgrupp och dina kunder. Du har dessutom förmågan att anpassa din projektledarstil mot rådande omständigheter i dina projekt. Du jobbar strukturerat, proaktivt och prioriterar väl för att hålla projektmål. Du kan leda dig själv och andra att uppnå uppsatta projektmål, där du har ett ”vi”-tänk”, och vill bidra till ett bra samarbetsklimat.  



Din erfarenhet:


* Flera års erfarenhet av att leda IT-projekt
* Van att orientera dig inom flera nivåer av en organisation och hantera många kontaktytor
* God teknisk förståelse av IT-lösningar, system och infrastruktur
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av att jobba som konsult
Meriterande med certifieringar inom projektledning  

* 
**Varför** **Telia Cygate?**

På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.  



Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.  

  



Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan!  



**Låter det intressant? Ansök!**

Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team! Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.  

  



Placeringsort: Malmö eller Helsingborg  

  



Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta mig gärna, Anders Liljekow på anders.liljekow@cygate.se eller via LinkedIn. Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-03 -10.  

  



Bakgrundskontroll är en del i våra rekryteringsprocesser.  



  

**Välkommen** **till Telia Cygate – Home of Expert**
