title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Join our multicultural, agile team at **Indivd** and work alongside top experts from around the world. We offer a flexible work environment, allowing you to choose between working remotely, in an office, or a mix of both. Apart from scheduled meetings, you have the freedom to set your own work schedule.

### **Who We Are**


At Indivd, we are revolutionizing **computer vision and AI-powered insights** in the physical world—without compromising privacy. Our **patented AI-driven platform** helps store owners, shopping malls, and other businesses gain **unprecedented visibility** into customer behavior. Using advanced deep learning models, we provide high-accuracy insights to help businesses thrive.

### **What You’ll Do**


As a **Machine Learning Engineer**, you’ll play a crucial role in designing and optimizing state-of-the-art **deep learning models for computer vision**. You will be responsible for improving model performance, optimizing **GPU-based cloud deployment**, and collaborating with end-users to develop **meaningful insights**.

#### **Key Responsibilities**


Develop and optimize deep learning models for **computer vision applications**  

Improve **cloud-based GPU deployments** for efficiency and scalability  

Work closely with **data engineers and end-users** to design and implement insights  

Maintain and refine **high-performance ML pipelines**  

Research and integrate **cutting-edge techniques** to push the boundaries of accuracy and performance

### **What We’re Looking For**

#### **Must-Have Skills**


Strong experience with **C++** and **Python**  

Expert-level knowledge of **PyTorch/TensorFlow**  

Extensive experience in **computer vision, deep learning, and machine learning**  

Strong foundation in **statistics and data science**  

Upper-intermediate English proficiency

#### **Nice to Have (Bonus Skills)**


TensorRT and DeepStream optimization  

Experience in **facial recognition, object detection, and tracking**  

Expertise in **scalable ML deployment architectures**

### **Why Join Us?**


Competitive salary  

Freedom to work remotely or from the office  

Work with some of the **world’s leading AI experts, entrepreneurs, and investors**  

Opportunities for skill development through **training and seminars**  

Generous **stock options program** for key employees


**Ready to push the boundaries of AI-driven computer vision? Apply today!**

title: Next Generation: Tester
description:
We are actively seeking the next wave of tech talent through our NextGen graduate initiative in Stockholm. This opportunity is for recent graduates with 0-3 years of experience who are eager to launch a meaningful career in technology. Although we have an exceptional team in place, we are always focused on building for the future. If you're ready to make an impact, this is your chance to join us.

**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About the Opportunity**


5G is already a reality, and Ericsson is the leader in bringing it to the market. There has never been a better time for you to make your mark. A large group of skilled developers are working energetically to convert 5G plans into reality. We are growing and looking for more talent. Our unit is part of Development Unit Networks and responsible for driving baseband software product development end to end by having competence and capability to take on full feature responsibility. This includes product ownership of baseband products as well as responsibility for development plans and securing maintenance of the products. Our Unit is located mainly on different sites in Sweden, Canada, China and US.  



  

**What You Will Do**

* Develop (integrate and test) 5G and Cloud RAN baseband architecture, functionality, and features in an end-to-end as well as in a partly simulated environment
* Write inventive, high quality, clean, optimized test code for use in verification and continuous integration.
* Maintain and improve the quality of L1 and L2 part of the Baseband product by securing legacy coverage in test loops
* Perform trouble shooting and customer support
* Drive continuous improvements of products, environments, and processes
* Make sure that the right test environment is available in time, both the actual system test plant and the test environment with tools and automation frameworks.
* Analyze new requirements from new features

 **The Skills You Bring**

* Interest in and a drive to learn software test and integration
* MSc or equivalent in relevant technical field
* 0-3 years of relevant experience
* Programming/scripting skills (Java, Python, Erlang)
 ***Good to have:***

* Multi-core processor understanding
* Basic Real time embedded systems knowledge
* Mobile communication systems understanding

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Storage Administrator
description:
* We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Enterprise Storage Systems Administrator to design, implement, and manage our organization’s storage infrastructure.



  




* The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience in designing, deploying, and maintaining enterprise-level storage systems, including SAN (Storage Area Networks), NAS (Network Attached Storage), and cloud storage solutions.



  




* This role requires a deep understanding of storage technologies, data protection, performance optimization, and disaster recovery.

title: storage and Backup Admin
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Telecommunications, and Information Services
description:
**Storage and Backup Administrator** 




**Kista, Stockholm, Sweden** 




**Permanent** 




**Job description** 




**Key Responsibilities:** 




 Storage Management:
 


* Design, implement, and maintain the organization’s Storage Area Networks (SAN), Network-Attached Storage (NAS) systems.
* Monitor and manage storage performance, capacity, and utilization, ensuring efficient and optimal use of resources.
* Manage storage provisioning, including creating, allocating, and maintaining logical volumes, storage pools, and file systems.
* Perform storage performance tuning, capacity planning, and troubleshooting to ensure reliable and high-performing storage environments.
* Maintain and monitor data replication, mirroring, and cloning solutions for high availability and disaster recovery purposes.
* Manage storage integration with virtualization platforms (e.g., VMware, etc.) and on-premises environments



 Backup Management:
 


* Design, configure, and maintain backup infrastructure and solutions, ensuring all critical data is backed up in accordance with company policies and regulatory requirements.
* Develop and manage backup policies and schedules, ensuring timely and reliable backups of all key systems, databases, and files.
* Utilize backup technologies such as Veeam and EMC Networker
* Monitor backup jobs for failures, troubleshoot issues, and ensure successful data recovery when necessary.
* Regularly perform data recovery drills to validate the effectiveness of backup and disaster recovery solutions.



 Disaster Recovery & Data Protection:
 


* Develop and maintain comprehensive disaster recovery (DR) plans for storage and backup systems, ensuring minimal data loss and quick recovery in the event of an outage.
* Work closely with other teams to ensure that disaster recovery plans are regularly tested, validated, and updated based on changes to the environment.
* Implement and manage data retention and archiving policies in accordance with business and regulatory requirements.
* Ensure that all storage and backup systems comply with security protocols, including encryption, access controls, and auditing.



 Monitoring & Reporting:
 


* Monitor storage and backup systems for performance, capacity, and potential issues using management tools and dashboards.
* Generate regular reports on storage usage, backup success rates, data recovery readiness, and performance metrics.
* Proactively identify storage and backup issues and recommend improvements to increase system reliability and efficiency.



 Collaboration & Support:
 


* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including database administrators, application teams, and IT support, to ensure seamless integration of storage and backup systems with other enterprise infrastructure.
* Provide tier 2/3 support for storage and backup-related incidents, working quickly to resolve issues and restore services.
* Document storage and backup configurations, processes, and troubleshooting procedures for reference and audits.



**Qualifications:** 




 Required Skills:
 


* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing enterprise storage systems, including SAN, NAS and cloud storage solutions.
* Strong understanding of backup technologies e.g., EMC Networker, Veeam, Quantum Tape Library and disaster recovery methodologies.
* Hands-on experience with storage platforms from vendors such as Dell EMC Unity, Dell EMC Data Domain, NetApp, HPE Primera, 3PAR, Oracle ZFS and IBM.
* Proficiency in managing storage in virtualized environments (e.g., VMware vSphere, Aria, VMware Cloud Directory
* Knowledge of data replication, mirroring, and snapshot technologies for business continuity.
* Familiarity with RAID levels, block storage, object storage, and file system concepts.
* Strong troubleshooting skills for both storage and backup systems.



 Preferred Skills:
 


* Knowledge of scripting for automation (PowerShell, Python, Bash).
* Storage-related certifications such as NetApp Certified Data Administrator (NCDA), Dell EMC Proven Professional.
* Familiarity with networking concepts and data center infrastructure.
* ITIL certification for understanding service management best practices.



 Education and Experience:
 


* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience managing enterprise storage and backup solutions.
* Certifications in storage management and backup technologies are a plus.



**Additional Competencies:** 



* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills for working across teams and departments.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects or tasks simultaneously.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining the integrity and security of critical data.

title: Identity Engineer
description:
**Är du en driven Identity Engineer med erfarenhet av Entra ID, AD och hybridmiljöer? Vill du vara med på en spännande transformationsresa in i molnet? får du möjlighet att arbeta hands-on med att implementera och underhålla identitetslösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer.**
**Vad erbjuder vi?**
* En dynamisk och utvecklande arbetsmiljö där du får arbeta med den senaste tekniken.
* Möjlighet att påverka och sätta din prägel på våra tekniska lösningar.
* Stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling och karriärvägar.
* En arbetsplats där vi sätter teamet och våra värderingar i första rummet.
* Möjlighet till hybridarbete två dagar i veckan.
* Kollektivavtal, tjänstepension enligt ITP planen och trygghetsförsäkringar.
* Reseförmåner.


 ”Vi är en arbetsplats med ett stort kunnande och en stark drivkraft att ständigt förbättra vår verksamhet. Som en del av Nordic Leisure Travel Group erbjuder vi en spännande och utvecklande miljö med möjlighet till en intern karriär. Vår arbetsglädje och vårt höga engagemang visar sig i vår årliga medarbetarundersökning – och vi är stolta över att vara en arbetsplats där du kan växa och utvecklas.”
   

  

 Nordic Leisure Travel Group ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige och Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines, hotellkonceptet Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer cirka 1 325 000 resor årligen i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
* Högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande kunskap genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet och kunskaper inom IAM området, såsom JML, authorization, authentication och loggning/compliance
* Erfarenhet av Entra ID, AD och hybridmiljöer
* God förståelse för gruppolicyer, conditional access och MFA-konfiguration
* Goda kunskaper inom federerad SSO med SAML och OAuth
* Flytande svenska i både tal och skrift och goda kunskaper i engelska
* Bekant med koncept så som JIT, RBAC & Access Review.


 Vi letar efter dig som är strukturerad, noggrann och har en skarp analytisk förmåga. Du tar egna initiativ och har en helhetssyn som gör att du ser hur detaljerna samverkar med de större målen. Du trivs med problemlösning och har en naturlig fallenhet för att bygga och vårda relationer, vilket bidrar till ett framgångsrikt samarbete. För oss är dina personliga egenskaper avgörande – vi uppskattar ditt engagemang, din samarbetsförmåga och din drivkraft att utvecklas. Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt är meriterande.
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
* Implementera, standardisera och underhålla identitetsplattformar i molnet och on-prem
* Samarbeta nära med tvärfunktionella team för att anpassa lösningar utifrån verksamhetens behov
* Felsöka och lösa problem med tjänster och implementera nya lösningar
* Guida och supportera verksamhet och utvecklingsteam i identitetsrelaterade frågor.


 Som IT Identity Engineer kommer du att arbeta med att implementera och underhålla lösningar i både Azure och Onprem miljöer. Du kommer att vara en viktig del av vårt team och bidra till att driva arbetet inom identitet och access framåt. Ving befinner sig i en stor transformationsresa in i molnet och här blir du en central del. I rollen kommer du att arbeta hands-on med att implementera lösningar och supportera utvecklingsteam gällande frågor runt identitet och access.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i teamet Technology Services som ansvarar för ett modernt private cloud-datacenter byggt på Microsoft-teknologi och Azure public cloud-lösningar med fokus på SaaS och PaaS lösningar. Teamet strävar efter att ständigt förbättras och du kommer ges stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Intresserad? Skicka in ansökan snarast då urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Denna rekryteringsprocess innehåller bakgrundskontroll som sammanställer tidigare offentligt brottsregister och ekonomisk skuldupplysning.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Om du uppfyller grundkraven hos oss kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig och även mer information om dessa, men om du är nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos Alva Labs.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten kontakta Henrik Eriksson ( henrik.eriksson@nltg.com ).
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Technology Services
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 28 mars 2025
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Henrik Eriksson

title: Projektledare Infrastruktur
company_industry: Architecture and Planning, Civil Engineering, and Construction
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
  

**På AECOM levererar vi en bättre värld.**
  

 Vi på AECOM anser att en god infrastruktur skapar möjligheter för alla. Oavsett om det handlar om att förbättra din pendling, hålla ljuset på, ge tillgång till rent vatten eller att förbättra arkitektur så bidrar vårt arbete till att skapa bättre förutsättningar för samhällen och människor.
   

  

 Våra kunder litar på att vi använder de mest lämpade teamen, idéerna och tekniska kompetensen i vårt arbete inom transport, byggnader, vatten, miljö och förnybar energi. Vi är ett globalt etablerat företag - ca 50 000 anställda världen över - som drivs av ett gemensamt syfte och engagemang att leverera en bättre värld.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
  

 AECOM söker för närvarande en
 **Projektledare till vårt transportteam.**
  

 I din roll som projektledare kommer du bland annat att ansvara för och leda arbetet med att utveckla processen för leveranser inom projektet samt den övergripande hanteringen av delleveranser som successivt kommer att färdigställas i projektet. De kommer också att innefatta mer traditionella projektledningsuppgifter som: tidsplanering, kostnadsuppföljning, kvalitet, riskarbete, krishantering, osv.
   

  

 Du kommer att få möjlighet att arbeta med några av de mest intressanta infrastrukturprojekten i Sverige.
   

  

 Tjänsten passar dig som kan arbeta med en god grad av självständighet från dag till dag med uppgifter som omfattar skrivbordsstudier/genomförbarhetsstudier, markundersökningar och tolkningar till slutlig projektering.
   

  

 När du ansluter dig till oss kommer du att få kontakt och samarbeta med ett globalt nätverk av experter - planerare, projekterare, ingenjörer, forskare, konsulter, program- och byggledare - som leder förändringen mot en mer hållbar och rättvis framtid.
   

  

 På Stockholmskontoret kommer du att ingå i ett dynamiskt och växande team där du kan kombinera fördelarna med ett litet kontor på ett stort företag: självständighet, flexibilitet, global expertis och stabilitet.
   

  

 Här får du friheten att växa i en värld av möjligheter. Vi ger dig den flexibilitet du behöver för att prestera med hybridarbetsalternativ. Oavsett om du arbetar från kontoret, på distans i Sverige eller ute hos en kund kommer du att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där din integritet, entreprenörsanda och ditt banbrytande tankesätt förespråkas.
   

  

 Viktiga arbetsuppgifter är bland annat:
   

* Representant för AECOM:s projektteam gentemot kunden.
* Ansvara för att arbetspaket levereras i tid.
* Samordning av AECOM:s tekniska chefer/samordnare (Sverige, Spanien, Storbritannien och andra platser).
* Identifiera och kommunicera övergripande kundkrav till AECOM:s konstruktionsteam och övervaka genomförandet av kraven.
* Samordna och vara värd för möten om kundprojektering
* Samordna tvärvetenskaplig verksamhet, såsom seminarier och gränssnittskontroller.
* Ansvara för uppföljning och rapportering av projektresultat.
* Hantera och kommunicera projektändringar.
* Kundförhandlingar om ändringar i omfattning och budget.
* Övervaka att kvalitetsförfaranden följs och dokumenteras inom respektive tekniska discipliner.
* Stöd till BD/Group Manager för marknadssektorn i samband med anbud.
  


**Kvalifikationer**
  

 Minimikrav
   

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av projektledning av infrastrukturprojekt (vägar, järnvägar, försörjningsföretag).
* Utmärkt muntlig och skriftlig förmåga att kommunicera på både svenska och engelska.
* Driven och självständig.
  


 Kvalifikationer/erfarenhet:
   

* Multidisciplinär projekt- och konstruktionsledning.
* Erfarenhet av utveckling av detaljerad utformning och upphandlingsdokumentation (anbudskontrakt) för prestationsbaserade kontrakt och/eller kontrakt för konstruktion och byggande (AB04/ABT06).
* Erfarenhet av övervakning/uppföljning av byggarbetsplatser.
* Utbildning/erfarenhet i projektledning.
  


 Meriterande kvalifikationer:
   

* Kandidatexamen eller magisterexamen i civilingenjörsutbildning, PM/CM eller motsvarande.
  


 \
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
  

**Här får du friheten att växa i en värld av möjligheter.**
  

 Vi ger dig den flexibilitet du behöver för att kunna prestera med hybridarbetsalternativ. Oavsett om du arbetar från kontoret, på distans i Sverige eller ute hos en kund kommer du att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där din integritet, entreprenörsanda och ditt banbrytande tankesätt förespråkas.
   

  

 Du kommer att hjälpa oss att främja en kultur av jämlikhet, mångfald och inkludering - en säker och respektfull arbetsplats där vi bjuder in alla att ta med sig hela sitt jag till jobbet och använda sina unika talanger, bakgrunder och sin expertis för att skapa förändrande resultat för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi uppmuntrar dig att växa och utveckla din karriär hos oss genom våra tekniska och professionella utvecklingsprogram och mångsidiga karriärmöjligheter. Vi tror på ledarskap på alla nivåer. Oavsett var du befinner dig i organisationen kan du göra en bestående inverkan på de projekt du arbetar med, de team och kommittéer du går med i och vår verksamhet i helhet.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder konkurrenskraftiga löner och förmåner, välbefinnandeprogram för att stödja dig och din familj och de utvecklingsresurser du behöver för att avancera i din karriär.
   

  

 När du ansluter dig till oss kommer du att få kontakt och samarbeta med ett globalt nätverk av experter - planerare, projekterare, ingenjörer, forskare, konsulter, program- och byggledare - som leder förändringen mot en mer hållbar och rättvis framtid. Gå med oss och låt oss komma i gång.
   

  

**ReqID:** 
 J10107945
   

  

**Business Line:** 
 Transportation
   

  

**Business Group:** 
 DCS
   

  

**Strategic Business Unit:** 
 Europe & India
   

  

**Career Area:** 
 Program & Project Management
   

  

**Work Location Model:** 
 Hybrid
   

  

**Legal Entity:** 
 AECOM NORDIC AB

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

 Preferred Skills:
 


* Knowledge of scripting for automation (PowerShell, Python, Bash).
* Storage-related certifications such as NetApp Certified Data Administrator (NCDA), Dell EMC Proven Professional.
* Familiarity with networking concepts and data center infrastructure.
* ITIL certification for understanding service management best practices.



 Education and Experience:
 


* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience managing enterprise storage and backup solutions.
* Certifications in storage management and backup technologies are a plus.



**Additional Competencies:** 



* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills for working across teams and departments.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects or tasks simultaneously.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining the integrity and security of critical data.







**Regards,** 




 Rachana
 



 rachana@falconsmartit.com

title: Solutions Architect
description:
**About Keyfactor**
 Our mission is to build a connected society, rooted in trust, with identity-first security for every machine and human. Keyfactor helps organizations move fast to establish digital trust at scale — and then maintain it. With decades of cybersecurity experience, Keyfactor is trusted by more than 1,500 companies across the globe. We are proud to continually earn recognition as a Best Place to Work, and we achieve that through our amazing people who cultivate our culture as we grow. We hope you will trust your future with Keyfactor!
   

  

**Title:** 
 Solutions Architect
   

  

**Location:** 
 Sweden; Stockholm
   

  

**Experience:** 
 IC3
   

  

**Job Function:** 
 Professional Services
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full-time, Permanent
   

  

**Industry:** 
 Computer & Network Security
   

  

**Job Summary**
 The Solutions Architect leads complex solution deployments for enterprise-level customers. Acting as a trusted advisor, they provide expert guidance on technical aspects and best practices. They contribute to continuous improvement of processes and methodologies, mentor junior team members, and ensure high-quality service delivery.
   

  

**The position is based in Stockholm office in Sweden, we have hybrid work model and excellent working practices. Applicants must be living in Sweden and must hold a valid Right to Work in Sweden.**
**Job Responsibilities**
* Lead complex solution deployments for enterprise-level customers.
* Provide expert guidance on technical aspects and best practices.
* Assist with the continuous improvement of processes and methodologies.
* Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance.
* Act as a primary technical point of contact for customers.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions.
* Participate in the development of technical strategies and roadmaps.
* Resolve escalated technical issues promptly and effectively.
* Conduct in-depth technical assessments and provide recommendations.
* Assist in pre-sales activities and solution design.


**Minimum Qualifications, Education, And Skills**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or relevant field; or equivalent experience.
* Solid knowledge in a technical, MSP, or software consulting capacity.
* Comprehensive knowledge of industry standards, company operations, and advanced methodologies.
* Moderate understanding of core networking and infrastructure fundamentals.
* Moderate knowledge of Active Directory Certificate Services & Active Directory Federation Services.
* Moderate experience with Unix/Linux.
* Moderate experience with scripting development using various Microsoft tools (SQL, PowerShell, etc.).
* Moderate familiarity with Public-Key Infrastructure (PKI), digital certificates, and cryptography.
* Moderate familiarity with business application suites such as Microsoft 365.
* Ability to lead small projects, innovate within the role, and provide training to peers.


**Compensation**
 Salary will be commensurate with experience.
   

  

**Culture, Career Opportunities And Benefits**
 We build teams that continually strive to get better than the day before. You will be challenged daily and given opportunities to grow personally and professionally. We balance autonomy and structure to create an entrepreneurial environment to spur creativity and new ideas.
   

  

 Here are just some of the initiatives that make our culture special:
   

  

* Second Fridays (a company-wide day off on the second Friday of every month).
* Comprehensive benefit coverage, paid for by the company for you and your dependents (US).
* Generous paid parental leave (US).
* Dedicated employee-focused ambassadors via Key Contributors & Culture Committees.
* DIVERSE Commitment, a call to action for a more inclusive and diverse future in business, society, and technology.
* The Keyfactor Alliance Program to support DEIB efforts.
* Wellbeing resources, wellness allowance, mindfulness app free membership, Wellness Wednesdays.
* Global Volunteer Day, company non-profit matching, and 3 volunteer days off.
* Unlimited time off (US) and competitive time off globally.
* Monthly Talent development and Cross Functional meetings to support professional development.
* Regular All Hands meetings – followed by group gatherings.


**Our Core Values**
 Our core values are extremely important to how we run our business and what we look for in every team member:
   

  

**Trust** 
**is paramount.** 
  

  

*We deliver security software and solutions where trust and openness are of the highest importance for our customers. We are honest and a trusted partner in every aspect of business.*
**Customers** 
**are core.** 
  

  

*We strategize, operate, and execute through a customer-centric view. We prioritize the security interests of our customers, and we act as if their data were our own.*
**Innovation** 
**never stops, it only accelerates.** 
  

  

*The speed of change is accelerating. We are committed, through investment and focus, to stay ahead of the innovation curve.*
**We deliver with** 
**agility** 
**.** 
  

  

*We thrive in high-paced and continually changing environments. We navigate through newly added variables, adjust accordingly, while driving towards our strategic goals.*
**United by** 
**respect** 
**.** 
  

  

*Respect for all is what unites us. We promote diversity, inclusivity, equity, and acting with empathy and openness, both in our business and in our communities.*
**Teams** 
**make “it” happen.** 
  

  

*Vision and goals are not individually achievable – they require teamwork. We pride ourselves in operating as a cohesive team, creating promoters and partners, and winning as one.*
  

  

**Keyfactor is a proud equal opportunity employer including but not limited to veterans and individuals with disabilities.** 
  

  

**REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION:** 
 Applicants with disabilities may contact a member of Keyfactor’s People team via people@keyfactor.com and/or telephone at 1.216.785.2990 to request and arrange for accommodations at any time.
   

  

**Keyfactor Privacy Notice**

title: Solution Manager
description:
Do you want to take a key role in developing our technological backbone that drives operational excellence and empowers our front line to provide world-class customer experience? We are looking for two Solution Managers. One will be responsible for the Order to cash -Solutions and one for Customer Interactions - Solutions.
   

  

*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for a talented and passionate
 **Solution Manager** 
 to drive our contact center digitalization opportunities and manage solutions lifecycle. In this role you will join our newly formed Nordic Customer Solutions unit! The team is responsible for enabling our contact centers with world-class solutions, managing the technology roadmap and delivering future proof capabilities to our business stakeholders.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
 Own the end-to-end responsibility of solutions during their lifecycle in order to gain business and customer value.
   

  

  

* Overall responsibility of development life-cycles of solutions according to business and customer needs
* Close collaboration with business stakeholders, designers and architects to capture, define and prioritize needs and propose sustainable solutions
* Understand business processes and connect business requirements with functional capabilities of the solution
* Responsible for creating roadmap that takes into account strategic alignment and business value with the solution's life cycle
* Proactively improving processes and ways of working to gain cost savings and customer centricity
* Fostering a culture of continuous improvement
* Promote awareness of selected solutions within the organization. Ensure relevant stakeholders are engaged in ongoing development and business value realization
* Identifying opportunities for innovation
* Own part of IT landscape & budget from solution perspective
* Ensure high quality and user success


 We are looking for two Solution Managers. One will be responsible for the Order to cash -Solutions and one for Customer Interactions - Solutions.
   

  

**To excel in this role, you are expected to have:**
* A master's degree or equivalent and relevant work experience in IT
* At least 5 years of development experience and a successful track record in leading step change initiatives in an operational environment.
* Previous experience and good understanding of contact center environment and enablers
* Strategic thinking and the ability to bridge business goals with technological solutions
* Strong project management and stakeholder management skills
* Experience in agile ways of working and design thinking
* Excellent leadership, communication and collaboration skills
* Proficient in English written and verbal.
* Travelling is required


**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 17.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Alexandra Rossi via email at
 *alexandra.rossi* 
 @fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Sales Commission Analyst EMEA - 1 year contract
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Sales Commission Analyst to manage the full EMEA Commissions process, from SIP letter distribution to Payroll submission. The EMEA region consists of multiple products and teams, requiring a proactive and organized approach to ensure accuracy and efficiency in commission operations.
   

  

 The role offers you a great opportunity to have a significant impact, and to challenge the status quo, relating to automatization and improving processes.
   

  

 This role is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden. You will be reporting to VP FP&A EMEA and collaborating closely with Sales VPs, Regional CFO, and Payroll teams.
   

  

 This is a position with an initial contract of one year, with the potential to transition into a permanent role based on performance and business needs.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Prepare and distribute SIP letters for signing once quotas are finalized.
* Accurately calculate and process quarterly commission payouts, ensuring transparency and precision.
* Collaborate with Sales VPs to review and validate commission data.
* Submit finalized commission reports to the Payroll team for timely processing.
* Deliver clear and detailed commission statements to sales employees.
* Adjust operational GP data, incorporating credit notes, FX adjustments, and bad debt to ensure accuracy.
* Monitor and track monthly quotas, providing key insights into performance.


**Requirements**
 To be successful in this role you are a detail-oriented and analytical professional with experience from Commissions in a large company. You thrive in managing commission processes across multiple products and teams and have strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
   

  

* Proven experience in commission calculations, financial data analysis, and quota tracking.
* Ability to manage and analyze large datasets, organizing information effectively to derive key insights.
* Advanced user of Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and reporting.
* Experience in the following systems is a plus: Aaro, Tableau, Salesforce, SAP by Design, Great Plains, Netsuite
* Fluent in English with strong communication skills.


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: IT-Säkerhetsarkitekt till kund inom offentlig sektor.
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Är du en IT-säkerhetsarkitekt? Trivs du när du får jobba i en social roll med många kontaktytor? Har du arbetat som konsult eller i en linjebefattning och är ute efter nästa steg i din karriär?
   

  

**Då är det dig vi söker!**
 Just nu söker vi en IT-säkerhetsarkitekt till en av våra kunder inom offentlig sektor i Stockholm!
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en del av CGI Public där vi jobbar tätt tillsammans för många olika kunder. Vi söker dig som vill vara med och göra skillnad för våra kunder, där du får jobba med spännande uppdrag och vara med och på en strategisk och operativ nivå.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ett grupp fantastiska medarbetare och ledare kan vi erbjuda dig ett roligt och stimulerande arbete. Vi har en generös företagskultur och delar med oss av vår kunskap, vilket också är en förutsättning för att vi tillsammans ska lyckas med att utveckla vår verksamhet.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt hos oss kommer du att vara en nyckelperson som bidrar till att driva och ta fram efterfrågat material för att därefter kunna ta viktiga beslut inom både arkitektur och IT-säkerhetsfrågor.
   

  

 Rollen kommer bland annat innefatta att ansvara för säkerhetsutredningar och göra analyser på befintlig it-arkitektur, applikationsnivå eller systemnivå. du kommer också att utföra regelbundna säkerhetsbedömningar, identifiera potentiella sårbarheter och risker i IT-infrastrukturen, samt förslag för att åtgärda dessa.
   

  

 Rollen innefattar även att leda workshops samt möta kunder för att ta fram olika förslag på lösning och tidsestimat utifrån kundens behov.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen som söker vi dig som är problemlösare, ansvarstagande, flexibel och relationsskapande med ett brinnande intresse för IT-säkerhet och nätverk. Du trivs med att jobba både i grupp och självständigt.
   

  

* Vara väl insatt i tekniska standarder, protokoll, tekniker och produkter.
* Goda kunskaper inom design av IT-infrastruktur, nätverk, applikationsdrift och Operativsystem.
* Erfarenhet av Identitetshantering samt sårbarhetshantering.
* Stark social och kommunikationsförmåga med fokus på att skapa goda relationer.
* Stark analytisk förmåga för att enkelt sätta sig in i och förstå komplexa miljöer och kontexter. samt hur komponenter är relaterade till varandra.


 Det är även meriterande om du har erfarenhet av systemutveckling och/eller projektledning.
   

  

 Du kan flytande svenska, både i tal och skrift, då våra kunder primärt finns inom den publika sektorn samt behärskar engelska som är CGIs koncernspråk samt har en akademisk examen som högskoleingenjör eller motsvarande civil-/master examen inom exempelvis IT-säkerhet, data IT eller nätverk, alternativt relevant erfarenhet från liknande roll.
   

  

**På grund av tjänstens karaktär kräver att du har svenskt medborgarskap då du arbetar med säkerhetsklassificerad information och samhällskritiska system.**
**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: CRM & Automation Specialist
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a CRM & Automation Specialist, you will join our growing global marketing team creates Salesforce automation campaigns that are powered by data and leverages real-time insights to create a personalized
 **customer experience** 
 .
   

  

 Your role will focus on creating campaigns that track customer engagement at all digital touchpoints and tailor communication to support them by using Salesforce Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and
 **Pardot** 
 .
   

  

 While having the opportunity to collaborate directly with a global marketing team and key stakeholders, you will initiate effective marketing campaigns online and translate business goals into successful marketing campaigns. You will have the ability to help shape the strategy and success of global online marketing campaigns and automated customer journeys across multiple channels.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Build and maintain automation journeys in Pardot to support campaigns.
* Lead collaborations to determine automation project needs and requirements, set and manage expectations for each campaign.
* Design, implement, and optimize web forms to capture leads and enhance customer data collection.
* Identify automation opportunities across digital platforms and provide guidance.
* Interpret and visualize Salesforce campaign data to support decision making.
* Ensure all customer record data is successfully segmented for success.
* Review customer behavior to determine areas of improvement.
* Recommend more effective data strategy and segmentation.
* Implement best practices for data hygiene and governance to prevent recurring sync errors and improve automation reliability.
* Document automation processes and best practices for scalability and knowledge sharing.
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPPA) in customer data and automation processes.


**Please note:** 
 This role is a
 **fixed-term and full-time role** 
 starting from May 2025 until the end of 2025, which possibility to extend. This is a
 **hybrid** 
 role, 1-2 days a week at our office in Stockholm city.
   

  

**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone that has:
   

  

* At least 3 years of experience in Salesforce Sales Cloud or Marketing Cloud and Pardot is required.
* Equivalent education level of Bachelor or Associate Degree in Digital Marketing or a related field is required.
* Strong project management skills along creative and strategic problem-solving skills.
* Ability to drive results by working directly with stakeholders, communicating and collaborating both with team members and cross-functionally.
* Excellent communication skills in both verbal and written English is required to communicate the value of automation to any audience.
* Ability to construct automation across multiple digital platforms and deep understanding of how automation can simplify and enhance the customer experience.
* Foundational understanding of GDPR is a plus.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Tech Lead to our team Payment Platform
description:
**At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be.**
 The Payments Platform Team is a backend heavy team that is responsible for the Payment Transactions, integration with our Payment Service Providers and Settlements Consolidation for our merchants. We stand on the transactional frontline, driven by an unwavering commitment to exceptional availability and performance levels.
   

  

**Current focus for your team:**
 ✔ Handles 50,000+ payment transactions per day
   

  

 ✔ On a journey from monolith to autonomy, and from on premise to cloud in AWS
   

  

 ✔ C#, .NET, AWS, Terraform, GitLab, Event Driven Architecture, RabbitMQ, MS SQL Server, New Relic, Kibana
   

  

**Your focus will be to:**
 You will lead the design of technical solutions aligned with our overarching strategies and guide your team's development activities by assisting in breaking down tasks and estimate efforts needed to reach your goals. You will divide your time between leading the team as well as doing hands on coding.
   

  

 You will ensure that the team's solutions adhere to Qliro’s guidelines and meet regulatory and security standards and implement tactics to improve and maintain code quality.
   

  

 Communicate the product team’s target architecture and vision to the team as well as supporting the Product Manager with your team's technical perspectives in their discovery, planning and stakeholder management.
   

  

 You will mentor less experienced team members by providing constructive feedback as well as collaborate with our Engineering Manager to further develop the team's competence.
   

  

 As a tech lead at Qliro, you are also a part of out extended leadership team where you will discuss strategies with leaders across Qliro in order to further redefine what Qliro and Payments can be.
   

  

**What we are looking for in our new team lead:**
 👩‍💻You are highly experienced in C# .NET and have touched the majority of tools in the rest of the stack
   

  

 🦸🏽‍♀️ Leadership skills to inspire and guide the team in the transition to a modern architecture prepared for Qliro’s current and future business needs
   

  

 🚀 You have practical experience from working with agile engineering methods combined with a solid understanding of software engineering best practices
   

  

 ☁️ Since we are doing a cloud journey, migrating to AWS from on prem solutions, it is considered a plus if you have worked with cloud technologies
   

  

 🤖 You have an understanding of system design, data structures, API development and algorithms
   

  

 💰 If you have worked with payment transactions before, it is highly beneficial
   

  

**If this sounds like you, we would really like to get in touch - please apply below!**

title: Software Engineer, Ceph & Distributed Storage
description:
The role of a Software Engineer, Ceph & Distributed Storage at Canonical
   

  

 As a software engineer at Canonical, you have a key role in the success of Ubuntu, our partners, customers, and the larger Ubuntu community. Your primary responsibility is to your team - contributing toward objectives, continuously improving, and striving to be a vital part of a healthy, high-performing team. At Canonical, you will have the opportunity to influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 As part of Cloud Engineering, you'll be building modeling software to drive systems such as OpenStack, Ceph, and Kubernetes with a focus on distributed storage and Ceph. You'll be engineering solutions to scale in production, working with our field teams to ensure we're meeting the needs of customers looking to adopt cutting-edge technology.
   

  

 Applicants should be passionate about the future of the software defined datacenter, distributed systems, and open source. Canonical is a globally distributed team of engineers who share that passion, and you will need to work well in that context. Engineers who thrive at Canonical are mindful of the dynamics of the open source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large, innovative organizations.
   

  

 This job involves international travel several times a year, usually for one week at a time.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role will be based remotely in EMEA or the Americas regions
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Write high quality, rigorously designed Python and Golang software
* Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
* Debug issues and produce high quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation that define best practices for authoring high quality operators
* Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions
* Develop and maintain software for delivery, operations and life-cycle management of Ceph storage


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have experience with writing modern, maintainable Python
* You have experience with Ceph storage
* You love technology and working with brilliant people
* You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable
* You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated
* You have interest and experience with two or more of the following: Linux, Kubernetes, Public cloud, OpenStack, LXC/LXD, Python, Go, Debian packaging
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and preferably university
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience operating Ceph clusters in production
* Experience with open source distributed storage such as Gluster, Minio, Mayastor or similar


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues from your team and others
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: IXL Application Design Engineer
description:
At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.

  


**Could you be the full time IXL Application Design Engineer we are looking for in Stockholm?**

  


**Your future role:**


Working with railway signalling has never been more exciting than now. The new European standard, ERTMS is on its way to reshape the future of public transportation. You will work on designing and developing the software for computerised interlocking system (CBI). Our product is the requirement framework deciding how and in which way the rail traffic may be managed in a country. The process includes identification and formalisation of customer requirements, design and implementation of new functionality and test and verification of our products. During the whole process the safety work is documented and finally approved by official authorities in the country where the client is located.

  


In the role of IXL Application Design Engineer, you will be part of a team of developers, testers, and verifiers. We work with our own proprietary tools that you will learn in the work. Working with Alstom will give you a unique possibility to gain in depth knowledge in the technical aspect of our business.

  


**We'll look to you for:**


* Interpret interlocking requirements
* Create and review design and test documents
* Implement interlocking requirements in interlocking logic software
* Conduct functional testing of interlocking logic software
* Deliver on time with required quality, following applicable internal and external rules and regulations in the project work
* Interface with other parts of the company as needed: Requirement Engineers, System and Project Engineers
* Maintain and improve work methods and processes
* Set requirements on and evaluate applicable tools
* Give related support to Site Engineering

  




**All about you:**


* Bachelor or Master of Science or Engineering or equivalent.
* Software engineering/ Software development knowledge
* Knowledge about safety standards and regulations desirable
* Experience from signalling or railway industry is an advantage
* Fluent English is mandatory for this role; Swedish is an advantage

  




**Things you’ll enjoy**


Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:


* Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
* Work with new security standards for rail signalling
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues to accelerate your personal growth
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Utilise our hybrid working environment
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
* Progress towards to senior positions
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, sports card)

  




You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!

  


**Important to note!**


As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 70+ countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

  


  

**Job Segment:** Testing, Developer, Technology
company_description: Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation.

title: Installation Specialist
description:
Linköping, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

**Vad du kommer att göra på Elekta**


Är du en problemlösare med erfarenhet av tunghantering, elektronik och mekanik i kombination med mjukvara? Trivs du med att resa och arbeta nära kunden på ett lösningsorienterat sätt? Då kan rollen som Installationsspecialist vara något för dig!


I denna roll ingår du i Elektas division *Business Line Neuro Solutions* och arbetar med Elektas *Gammakniv*. Du får möjlighet att arbeta internationellt och ansvara för installationer på sjukhus runtom i världen. Installationsprocessen är uppdelad i två faser:

* Fas 1: Tunghantering och laddning av kobolt-60-källor
* Fas 2: Montering, installation och testning av systemet


Här arbetar du tvärdisciplinärt inom mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar bland annat:

* Montering av tung utrustning
* Installation och montering av system
* Fungera som länk mellan sjukhuspersonal och Elekta, eskalera uppkomna problem och säkerställa att dessa åtgärdas
* På sikt agera stöd och vägleda andra ingenjörer inom Elektas organisation
* Identifiera och genomföra förbättringar som ökar kundnöjdheten


Du utgår från Elektas kontor i Linköping och rapporterar till installationschefen.

**Rätt egenskaper**

* Du är kommunikativ och trivs med att samarbeta i team
* Du har ett öppet och prestigelöst förhållningssätt, anpassar dig till olika kulturer och löser problem på ett lösningsorienterat sätt
* Du är självgående och tar gärna eget initiativ, med ett strukturerat arbetssätt
* Du har inga problem med att resa i tjänsten och värdesätter kundnöjdhet högt

**Vad du tar med dig**

* Ingenjörsutbildning eller minst fem års dokumenterad erfarenhet av installations-/servicearbete
* B-körkort
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Erfarenhet av minst ett av följande områden är meriterande:

* Medicinska system
* Montering av tunga maskiner (tunga lyft)
* Radioaktivt material och strålsäkerhet
* Automatiserade styrsystem
* Har du kunskap inom flera av dessa områden är det extra meriterande
* Det är också meriterande om du har erfarenhet av en resande tjänst

**Vad du får**


I den här rollen arbetar du för ett högre syfte – hopp för alla som drabbas av cancer och för att alla, oavsett var i världen de befinner sig, ska ha tillgång till den bästa cancervården. Utöver detta erbjuder Elekta en rad förmåner:

* 30 betalda semesterdagar per år, samt 4 extra Elekta-dagar per år (utöver röda dagar)
* Attraktivt premiebaserat pensionsprogram
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Lunchförmån
* Bidrag till friskvårdsaktiviteter

**Rekryteringsprocess**


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på “ansök”-knappen. Observera att vi **inte** tar emot ansökningar via e‑post. Urvalet sker löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.

**Din kontakt på Elekta**


Vid frågor om rollen vänligen kontakta ansvarig Talent Acquisition Partner, Gustaf Ericson, på gustaf.ericson@elekta.com.**Vi är en arbetsgivare som värdesätter mångfald och inkludering**


Vi utvärderar kvalificerade sökande utan hänsyn till ålder, ras, hudfärg, religion, kön, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller könsuttryck, genetisk information, nationalitet, funktionsvariation, veteranstatus eller någon annan status som skyddas enligt lag i de länder där Elekta är verksamt.

***Om Elekta/About Elekta***

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.*

*More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives, and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it’s personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combines passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care.* ***We don’t just build technology, we build hope.***

*Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with a presence in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit* *elekta.com* *or follow @Elekta on Twitter and on LinkedIn.*

title: 2nd Line Customer Support Engineer - Finance
description:
- Huvudfokus i rollen handlar om att identifiera och prioritera samt lösa olika frågor och problemställningar från våra kunder genom att verifiera, testa och felsöka i Jeeves ERP inom området Finance  

  

* Din framgång i denna roll handlar därmed tills stor del om att ha en nyfikenhet och vilja att förstå kundens verksamheten för att kunna supportera dem på bästa sätt.

  

* Vårt team brinner för att skapa det fulla värdet av Jeeves ERP hos våra kunder. Vi har ett mycket nära samarbete inom gruppen och hjälps åt samt löser problem tillsammans!

  

* Du kommer även att ha ett tätt samarbete med framför allt vår Produktavdelning, R&D & konsultfunktionen på Jeeves.

  

* Support, analys, problemsökning och lösning av ärenden inom Finance.

  

* Gäller att kunna ta för sig och att driva sin egen kompetens och utveckling framåt. Krävs mycket god samarbetsförmåga, vi jobbar mycket i att lösa problem i gruppnivå.



Responsibilities


- Fokus i rollen är att hantera ärenden där dina främsta arbetsuppgifter består av att identifiera och prioritera samt lösa olika frågor och problemställningar genom att verifiera, testa och felsöka i Jeeves affärssystem.  

  

* Support, analys, problemsökning och lösning av ärenden inom området Finance.

  

* Gäller att kunna ta för sig och att driva sin egen kompetens och utveckling framåt. Krävs mycket god samarbetsförmåga, vi jobbar mycket i att lösa problem i gruppnivå.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


* Verksamhetsserfarenhet inom Finance, samt applikationserafenhet från Jeeves kompenserar utbildning.
* 2-3 års applikationserfarenhet av affärssystem är ett krav. Jeeveskompetens är önskvärd.
* Du har god kunskap inom Finance, erfarenhet från verksamhetsområden inom Finance och är väl insatt i dagliga rutiner och processer inom Finance området
* Arbetserfarenhet och kunna läsa SQL-kod - komplexiteten ligger i att kunna felsöka utifrån SQL, kunna läsa och förstå kod.
* Förstå övriga flöden som gränsar till Finance
* Som person är du en god lyssnare och har en mycket god förmåga att analysera och lösa problem. Du är affärsmässig där du drivs av att leverera god service och med högsta kvalitet.
* På Jeeves sätter vi värde på engagemang och nyfikenhet samt prestigelöshet, eftersom vi är övertygade om att det driver utvecklingen framåt både för oss och för våra kunder.
* Du skall vara van vid att arbeta i grupp samt även kunna ta egna initiativ och beslut.
* Du talar och skriver både svenska och engelska flytande.
Über Forterro


Forterro wurde 2012 gegründet und hat sich zu einem der führenden Anbieter von Industriesoftware entwickelt - mit Niederlassungen in den wichtigsten Produktionsländern Europas sowie regionalen Servicezentren und Entwicklungszentren auf der ganzen Welt. Von mehr als 40 Standorten aus stellen unsere über 1.700 Mitarbeiter Software für mehr als 13.000 Industrieunternehmen bereit und unterstützen diese. Unsere Produkte sind tief in den Anforderungen der jeweiligen Region verwurzelt. Jedes Produkt ist darauf ausgerichtet, die Fähigkeit unserer Kunden zu stärken und zu beschleunigen, effizient zu arbeiten und wettbewerbsfähig zu sein.

**Abteilung**


Support & Education Services


**Beschäftigungsart**


Befristeter Vertrag


**Standort**


Schweden, Remote

Hybrid
